Headline: Spain Energy Regulator OKs Acciona-Enel Bid For Endesa -4-
Story: The Acciona-Enel bid, which values Endesa at EUR42.53 billion, must now be approved by Spain's stock market regulator, CNMV.   The offer will be conditional on the acceptance of shareholders representing over 50% of Endesa's total stock - that is, just over 4% of minority shareholders - and on the removal of several Endesa bylaws, including one that limits voting rights by any single shareholder to 10%.   If the CNMV approves Acciona and Enel's bid prospectus, it will set a timetable for shareholders to tender their stock.   Company Web site: http://www.endesa.com   -By David Roman, Dow Jones Newswires, 34 913958125, david.roman@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:20 ET (15:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Nokia Siemens Networks: Nebula Starts Offering Broadband Svcs
Story: Edited Press Release     STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--Nokia Siemens Networks Wednesday said Finnish Internet service provider Nebula is starting to offer its customers in the Helsinki capital area up to 100 Mbit/s broadband internet connections, using a VDSL2 solution provided by Nokia Siemens Networks.   Nebula plans to connect the first VDSL2 customers within few weeks, Nokia Siemens Networks said.   The new Nokia Siemens Networks VDSL2 broadband solution makes very high data rates possible in densely populated areas using local copper telephone network.   The solution provides fast symmetric connections with very high upstream speed in a cost-efficient way, in addition to even faster downstream connections.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 08:19 ET (12:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Turkey To Hold Petkim Block Sale Tender Thursday -IHA -3-
Story: The government aims to complete the block sale of a 51% stake in Petkim this year after it delayed a planned block sale of Halkbank, the privatization of tobacco and cigarettes firm Tekel, and the sale of three electricity distribution grids in the face of presidential and parliamentary elections this year.   The OIB raised $287.7 million in a public offer for a 34.5% public stake in Petkim in April 2005.   Currently OIB holds a 54.79% stake in Petkim. Other than the 7% held by Emekli Sandigi the remaining shares are traded on the stock exchange.   In early March, Capital Markets Board or SPK exempted the possible buyer in the planned Petkim block-sale tender from the obligation of holding a mandatory tender offer for minor shareholders.   Under Turkish law, a company must hold a tender offer to minority shareholders if it gains more than 25% of a Turkish company, or if the purchase is to impact on management control.   Petkim posted a first-quarter net profit of 50.13 million new Turkish lira ($38.7 million) versus TRY3 million net profit in the same period of 2006.   Petkim shares ended Wednesday unchanged at TRY9, in a 1.6% higher overall market.     Agency Web sites: http://www.ihavideo.net and http://www.iha.com.tr     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:53 ET (14:53 GMT)

Headline: Dow Chemical In Talks With EPA Over Dioxin Cleanup - NYT
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Dow Chemical Co. (DOW) is negotiating with the Environmental Protection Agency over the timing and procedures to clean up three areas of dioxin-contaminated sediments in a Michigan river that flows past its main manufacturing plant, The New York Times reported on its Web site late Tuesday.   The negotiations were prompted last week when the agency decided to order the cleanup. A spokesman for Dow said it was already working on cleaning up the highly toxic dioxin.   The Times reported that Margaret Guerriero, director of the land and chemicals division for the environmental agency's regional office in Chicago, said: "Our concern was that they were not moving fast enough, and this was going to get protracted because of the seasonal nature of the work. There is only a certain window every year when you can go in and do the work. We were worried that it was going to slip."   "A good bit of what they were asking us to do to - in their words, hurry the process up - we had already agreed to do, and to some extent gotten that work under way," the Times reported Dow Chemical spokesman John Musser as saying.   The sites are within six miles of the plant in Midland, Mich. One is not far from the plant, 30 to 70 feet from the riverbank. The dioxin is in sediments 2 to 10 feet below the surface of the Tittabawassee River.   Newspaper Web Site: http://www.nytimes.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:12 ET (05:12 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: EU Fines Telefonica EUR151.9M, Tightening Mkt Grip
Story: By Jason Sinclair   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MADRID (Dow Jones)--The European Commission slapped a hefty fine on Telefonica SA (TEF) Wednesday for abusing its dominant position in the broadband market, as the EU watchdog rachets up its control on the European telecoms sector.   The largest telecommunications company in Spain and Latin America was fined EUR151.9 million for operating a margin squeeze on its high-speed Internet competitors since 2001. This is the biggest fine against a telecommunications company ever imposed by the Commission.   The Brussels antitrust watchdog found the wholesale cost of accessing Telefonica's broadband network was so close to prices charged to consumers that rivals were unable to earn a sufficient margin, shutting them out of the market. The commission also argued the rollout of competitors broadband networks has been slower in Spain than in other European countries due to Telefonica's practices.   Telefonica balked at what it said were conflicting criteria between the EU regulator and the Spanish telecom regulator, the CMT.   "The CMT hasn't ruled against us for these reasons, and it seems strange that after years of accepting our prices and practices, now a different regulator is saying there was wrongdoing," a company spokesman said.   At 0956 GMT, Telefonica shares were 0.5% higher at EUR16.52 in an overall positive Madrid market.   "Telefonica has a market capitalization of EUR79 billion and the impact of this fine is minimal, what could be more significant is if Telefonica is now facing a more restrictive regulatory scrutiny from Brussels," UBS analyst Bosco Ojeda said. UBS rates Telefonica at neutral with a EUR17.70 price target.   The hefty fine also signals a departure from the EU's former soft-glove approach to regulating European telecommunications companies. In 2003, two other telecommunications incumbents, France Telecom (FTE) and Deutsche Telekom AG (DT) were fined EUR10.4 million and EUR12.6 million respectively for similar infractions. But since Neelie Kroes took the helm as EU Competition Commissioner in 2004, the EU has tightened its grip on antitrust infractions, and hiked its fines.   "Brussels is trying to make an example out of the  Telefonica case and send a message to the European national regulators," Juan Tuesta from local brokerage Banesto said. "It's clear the EU is trying to wrestle control from domestic regulators, what remains to be seen is how far they are going to go," Tuesta added.     Company Web site: http://www.telefonica.com     -By Jason Sinclair, Dow Jones Newswires, 34 913958127, jason.sinclair@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:10 ET (10:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Globex Mining: Comprehensive Program Underway At Getty Lead-Zinc Deposit>GMX.T
Story: ROUYN-NORANDA, QUEBEC--(CCNMatthews - July 4, 2007) - GLOBEX MINING ENTERPRISES INC. (TSX:GMX)(G1M - Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Berlin, Munich, Xetra)(PINK SHEETS:GLBXF) is pleased to provide shareholders with an update on Globex's Getty lead-zinc royalty property in Nova Scotia held by Acadia Mining Corporation (TSX VENTURE:ADA).    Globex holds a one percent (1%) GMR royalty on all mineral production from the property, one half of which can be purchased by Acadian Mining at anytime for $300,000.    According to an Acadian Mining Corporation press release dated June 27, 2007 the following work has begun on the property.    "A comprehensive program is underway to further evaluate the development potential of the Getty Deposit (lead-zinc) located 700 metres west of the Scotia Mine's "Main Deposit". The program includes completing a National Instrument 43-101 compliant resource estimation based on historical drill data and a diamond drilling program comprising at least 100 drill holes. The drilling program will include re-drilling selected historical holes, in-fill drilling to provide coverage on 50 metre centers and exploration holes to expand the deposit. The exploration drilling will comprise approximately 35 holes, representing approximately one-third of the drill program."    Globex is pleased with the scope of the program being undertaken and the rapid rate at which it is being done.  The Getty property is one of a series of active royalty properties within Globex's royalty portfolio.  Others include the Fabie Bay copper-silver deposit, the Magusi River copper, zinc, gold, silver deposit, the SRA Tennessee Zinc mines, the Russian Kid gold deposit and the Rousseau gold deposit.    Also, for shareholders information, Jack Stoch, President of Globex Mining Enterprises Inc. has given an internet interview which is now posted on the web site of Wallst.net. Headline: MARKET TALK: Euro Hotel Sector Readacross From Hilton Buy
Story: 0649 GMT [Dow Jones]--The European hotel sector is seen getting a fillip Wednesday after Hilton Hotels (HLT) agrees to be acquired by Blackstone for $18.5b in cash plus the assumption of $7.5b in debt. "It is the biggest ever hotel deal, and will make Hilton the 8th US public hotel company to go private this year," says an analyst. He reckons investor focus will naturally switch to Intercontinental Hotels Group (IHG) which still owns GBP1B in property assets, has a relatively unleveraged balance sheet, a valuable pipeline of 170K unopened rooms, and strong positions in emerging markets such as China. "IHG shares have been weak in recent weeks with the rest of the sector. We see M&A as a free option at the current share price," he adds. Says Accor (12040.FR) is less likely to be swallowed up than Intercontinental. IHG shares closed Tuesday at 1258p, Accor at EUR64.90. Headline: Katanga Mining Tgt Upped On "Quality Of Kamoto Assets":GMP
Story: TORONTO (Dow Jones)--GMP Securities Inc. raised its share-price target on Katanga Mining Ltd. (KAT.T) to C$22.50 from C$20 "to reflect the quality of [Katanga's] Kamoto assets and in anticipation of metal production this fall."   Katanga is trading up 1.8% at C$19.69 in Toronto.   In a research report Wednesday, analyst David Charles said the company is still on-budget and on-target to ship its finished copper production from the Kamoto redevelopment project in December of this year.   Charles said that if Katanga were to become the subject of a takeover bid like the recent bid by Teck Cominco Ltd. (TCK) for Aur Resources Inc. (AUR.T), he believes the multiple offered would be higher than 1.1 times net asset value, despite the higher political risk associated with the Democratic Republic of Congo. He raised his target multiple to 1.2 times the net asset value from 1.1 times NAV to better reflect the multiple being offered (1.75 times NAV) by Teck for Aur.   As reported Tuesday, Teck offered C$4.1 billion in cash and stock for Aur to enhance its copper production and reserves.   Charles noted that Katanga plans a special meeting of shareholders on July 17, at which management will seek to increase the company's authorized share capital. He expects that any future share issuance could result in the dilution of Central Africa Mining & Exploration Co.'s 22% interest in Katanga. He added that the recent increase in RP Explorer Master Fund's stake in Katanga will act as a counter-balance to CAMEC's stake. RP Explorer recently acquired 4,675,000 shares of Katanga, raising its stake to 15.7% from 9.8%.   Charles, who doesn't own shares of the London mining company, maintained his rating on Katanga at buy.   GMP has an investment-banking relationship with Katanga.   Company Web site: http://www.katangamining.com     -Tara Zachariah, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2100     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 12:07 ET (16:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Pfizer Asks Nigerian Court To Dismiss State-level Case
Story: KANO, Nigeria (AP)--Pfizer Inc. (PFE) asked a court Wednesday to dismiss a state-level civil case seeking $2 billion in damages over allegations that the company conducted a drug experiment that led to deaths and disabilities among children more than a decade ago.   Pfizer, the world's largest pharmaceutical company, has denied those charges, which are at the heart of a separate case filed by the federal government seeking $7 billion.    Wednesday, in the northern city of Kano, the company argued that the state-level court lacked jurisdiction over the case, and that Pfizer had been served papers incorrectly. The judge's ruling was scheduled for July 30.   A separate criminal case seeking to hold several Pfizer officers personally responsible is scheduled to have its next hearing on July 9 in Kano.   New York-based Pfizer has denied any wrongdoing. A federal court in New York City dismissed a 2001 lawsuit by disabled Nigerians who allegedly took part in the study; that case is under appeal.   All the cases stem from the same mid-1990s drug study. Nigerian authorities allege that Pfizer illegally conducted a drug experiment on 200 children during a 1996 meningitis epidemic in Kano state's main city, also called Kano, resulting in deaths, brain damage, paralysis and slurred speech in many of the children.   Pfizer treated 100 meningitis-infected children with an experimental antibiotic, Trovan. Another 100 children, who were control patients in the study, received an approved antibiotic, ceftriaxone - but the dose was lower than recommended, the families' lawyers alleged.   Up to 11 children in the study died, while others suffered physical disabilities and brain damage. Pfizer always insisted its records show none of the deaths was linked to Trovan or substandard treatment.   In the Abuja civil case, the government is asking for $500 million for treatment, compensation and support for the victims of the drug test and their families. Another $450 million is earmarked for damages related to money spent to overcome concerns among Nigerians because of the test, and $1 billion is sought to pay for health programs. The federal government is also seeking $5 billion in general damages.   Authorities in the Kano state are blaming the Pfizer controversy for widespread suspicion of government public health policies, particularly the global effort to vaccinate children against polio.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 08:39 ET (12:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MARKET TALK: UK Hotels Stocks Rise On Hilton Offer
Story: 0741 GMT [Dow Jones] Hotel stocks are higher after Blackstone's bid for Hilton Hotels (HLT) in the US. Headline: EU Fines Telefonica EUR151.9M For Abuses In Broadband Mkt -2-
Story: About 80% of Spain's high-speed Internet connections are made over fixed telephone lines.   Telefonica, a state-owned monopoly until 1997, is the only Spanish telecommunications company with a nationwide fixed-line network. This enabled the company to rig the country's broadband market, the commission said, noting that between September 2001 and December 2006, the margin between Telefonica's retail prices and the prices for wholesale broadband access were too thin for other providers to cover their costs.   "The margin squeeze that Telefonica imposed on its competitors not only raised their costs, but also harmed customers significantly. When consumers and businesses are harmed in such a major market, the entire economy suffers," the commission's top antitrust official, Neelie Kroes, said in a statement.   The commission's penalty is part of a broader effort to shake up Europe's telecommunications sector, which is still dominated by former state-owned monopolies. Over the past year, the regulator has pressed operators to lower mobile phone roaming charges.   The commission last week took Germany to court for giving Deutsche Telekom AG (DT) a legal monopoly over the country's broadband network.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:33 ET (09:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: CANADA VENTURE: Northwestern's Pure Niger U3O8 Play
Story: By Brian Truscott     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     VANCOUVER (Dow Jones)--Uranium plays the world over are now a common sight - U.S. analyst James Dines got it very right back at the start of the year when he was calling for US$100-plus prices for a pound of the stuff, thanks in part to increasing demand for alternative energy sources.   Well-known players such as Cameco Corp. (CCJ) and Areva (427583.FR) were just two of the few high-profile companies dealing in yellow cake at the start of the decade. That's now changed, with hundreds of companies poking and proding various basins around the world.   Enter Northwestern Mineral Ventures Inc. (NWT.V), a TSX Venture-listed company primarily active in Niger and Quebec - two of the world's key uranium-rich distinations.   "We've specialized in acquiring large land positions in districts known for uranium deposits; we're not interested in small land packages around the world and that's why we've focused on Niger and Quebec," said Marek Kreczmer, Northwestern's president and chief executive.   This has created a perfect storm, of sorts. In June, Northwestern signed a 50/50 joint-venture agreement with another uranium play, Uramin Inc. (UMN.LN), forming a new company that will soon be listed on the London Stock Exchange Group PLC's (LSE.LN) Alternative Investment Market.   The deal - and the business - is all about eight highly prospective claims in Niger, a country that started giving out new uranium licences in early 2006 - Northwestern was one of the first.   "At the time, we were looking for a partner - it was a strategy to minimize geological and political risk and to find (a company) well positioned to operate in Africa," Kreczmer said.   That strategy has paid off - for a number of reasons. The Uramin deal came just before another deal: Areva's US$2.5 billion deal to buy Uramin. That didn't alter Northwestern's Uramin agreement, which put US$4 million into its coffers plus a 38.5% interest in what will be a listed U.K. company.   "It's going to be a pure Niger uranium play - that's unique and it's one which is well-funded," Kreczmer said.   Areva's arrival also means serious access to additional historical data as well as a potential entry into other parts of Africa, he said. It doesn't hurt that Areva already has two uranuim-producing mines in Niger.   Kreczmer said Northwestern has board control of the new company - yet to be named - during the current exploration phase. "But once we hit the pre-feasibility phase, Uramin will take over operations," he said. "We are explorers and have no ambitions of being builders."   Ultimately, Northwestern should end up with about 35 million shares in the new joint-venture company. If the stock does well in the market, it will only help fuel the company's other core play in Canada.   "Yes, if it does well, we could be a cash-rich company; we would then make the decision to fund the company's operations and/or pay our existing shareholders," he said.   Coincidentally, Northwestern's Quebec property is adjacent to - you quessed it - an Areva-owned site that's about four or five times the size of Northwestern's own 800-square-kilometer claim, where Kreczmer's team has already identified 20 potential targets for further exploration.   Company Web Site: http://www.northwestmineral.com   - Brian Truscott, Dow Jones Newswires; 604-669-1595; brian.truscott@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 12:00 ET (16:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Toronto Stks Close Flat On Very Quiet Trading Day
Story: By Stuart Weinberg       OF DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--Toronto stocks closed flat Wednesday on one of the quieter days of the year, as many Canadian investors booked off on a week shortened by the Canada Day holiday while U.S. markets are closed for Independence Day.   According to preliminary data, the S&P/TSX Composite Index fell 4.35 points, or 0.03%, to 14060.39. Advances led declines 788 to 629. Trading volume was 166.20 million shares, down from Tuesday's total of 343.70 million shares.   The S&P/TSX 60 Index closed down 1.33 or 0.16%, to 805.76 points.  - -   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 16:20 ET (20:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Lundbeck Facing Crisis, Gearing Up For Acquisitions - Report
Story: STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--Danish pharmaceuticals company Lundbeck AS (LUN.KO) is facing a crisis with declining revenue in a few years and is gearing up to make acquisitions, said Lundbeck's Chief Executive Claus Braestrup in an interview with Jyllandsposten published Wednesday.   Currently, Lundbeck make 60% of its money from antidepressants Cipralex and Lexapro. Patents on those drugs run out in 2012 and 2014, and the pipeline of new drugs is thin.   "We're not talking about a catastrophe. Neither is it a deep crisis. But a crisis, yes," said Braestrup.   Braestrup said the newly hired Chief Financial Officer Anders Goetzsche's task is to establish a structure that will allow Lundbeck to make acquisitions, including having the financial ability, if opportunities arise.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.jp.dk     -Stockholm Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +46 8 545 130 90     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:46 ET (05:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Pivdennyi Bank Hires Banks For Debut Dollar-Denominated Bond
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Ukraine-based Pivdennyi Bank has mandated BNP Paribas and Standard Bank as joint bookrunners for its inaugural dollar-denominated eurobond issue, one of the bookrunners said Wednesday.   Investor roadshows begin in Singapore July 5, then move to Hong Kong July 6, followed by London July 9-10, Zurich and Geneva July 11, then end in Vienna and Frankfurt July 12.   The transaction will be launched and priced thereafter, subject to market conditions.   Moody's Investors Service Inc. is expected to rate the bond B1.   By Clare Connaghan, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0) 20 7842 9496; clare.connaghan@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 04:38 ET (08:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : /C O R R E C T I O N From Source -- Tax Optimized Return Oriented Securities Trust/>TO.A.T
Story: In c3597 transmitted at 09:28e today, an error occurred in the third    paragraph. The Ex-Dividend Date of June 11, 2007 should have read    July 11, 2007. Corrected copy follows:    TOROS Declares Regular Monthly Distributions    TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - The Manager of Tax Optimized Return Oriented Securities Trust ("TOROS") today announced the Trust's regular monthly distributions to holders of Income Securities (TSX: TO.A) and ROC Securities (TSX: TO.UN). Distributions are payable July 31, 2007 to holders of record on July 15, 2007. Headline: : TD Asset Management Inc. Launches Three New Pooled Funds>TD.T
Story: TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - As part of its ongoing commitment to broaden and deepen its institutional solution set, TD Asset Management Inc. (TDAM) announces the launch of three new pooled funds trusts (funds).    Among the funds are two 'Active Extension' or '130/30' Funds: the TD Emerald 130/30 Enhanced Canadian Equity Pooled Fund Trust and the TD Emerald 130/30 Enhanced U.S. Equity Pooled Fund Trust. These funds employ the same investment process as the successful quantitative enhanced equity strategies and market neutral hedge funds already managed by TDAM.    "130/30 Funds have proven very popular with U.S. institutional investors and TDAM is excited to be one of the first managers to bring these funds to the market in Canada, including a Canadian equity version," said Robin Lacey, Managing Director, TDAM.    TDAM has also launched its fourth multi-strategy portable alpha fund, the TD Emerald Multi-Strategy Canadian Bond Fund. Like its existing multi-strategy funds, this fund aligns TDAM's leading index management and product structuring skills with its successful proprietary alpha generating strategies. It targets 3% of excess return over the Scotia Capital Universe Bond Index with minimal additional risk.    "Clients large and small are searching the market place for strategies to generate additional return without substantially increasing risk - Portable Alpha is a proven and efficient risk-managed approach worth investigating," said Dino Bourdos, Vice President & Director, Portfolio Management, TDAM.    About TD Asset Management Inc.    TD Asset Management Inc. (TDAM) is one of Canada's largest investment management firms, with leading market positions in active, quantitative and passive portfolio management. TDAM is a fully integrated investment management business offering a wide-range of products and solutions to institutional and retail mutual fund clients including alternative investments and portfolio integration services such as transition management, rebalancing and overlay.    As of March 31st, 2007, TDAM and its affiliates had over C$164B in asset under management on behalf of pension, insurance, endowment/foundation and corporate clients, as well as high net worth and retail mutual funds.    TD Asset Management Inc. (TDAM) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of The Toronto-Dominion Bank (TD Bank).             /CONTACT: Lisa Hodgins, TD Bank Financial Group, (416) 983-2982, lisa.hodgins@td.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 14:27 ET (18:27 GMT)

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: BA, Ryanair Report Lower June Load Factors
Story: (This updates an item timed about 1359 GMT with comment from a BA executive and an analyst.)       By Rod Stone     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--British Airways PLC (BAY.LN) and Ryanair Holdings PLC (RYAAY) Wednesday said their airplanes were less full on average during June compared with a year earlier, although BA did report a healthy increase in lucrative premium passenger traffic.   BA said its passenger load factor fell to 80.5% from 81.9% a year earlier, while Ryanair saw its figures drop two percentage points to 85% from 87%.   Some carriers have reported softness in the intra-European market, owing partly to higher interest rates and increased ticket taxes, while the weaker dollar is hitting the flow of passengers into Europe from the U.S.   BA said passenger traffic - measured in revenue passenger kilometers, which factor in how far people are flown - declined 1.4%, with premium traffic up 1.4% and non-premium down 1.9%.   Actual passenger numbers fell 2.5% to just over 3 million. The growth in premium traffic is positive for BA as it makes much of its profits from big-spending first- and business-class passengers.   The premium growth helped push BA's shares higher, analysts said. At 1452 GMT, the shares were up 20 pence, or 4.9%, at 439 pence in London.   Andrew Fitchie, an analyst with Collins Stewart, said BA is still benefiting from good premium demand and, while the load factor fell, it remains strong and "bodes well for pricing." Collins Stewart has a buy rating.   Traffic on North American routes, measured in RPKs, declined 2.8% and by a similar amount on U.K/European routes.   The London-based carrier said market conditions remain broadly unchanged and that it is too early to assess how the latest security measures at British airports might hit forward bookings. It said weakness in the U.S. dollar to sterling isn't helpful for revenue but is having a positive impact on costs.   George Stinnes, head of investor relations at BA, said booking levels for the summer period remain good, although the airline continues to lose out to other European airports for long-haul transfer traffic.   Tighter security restrictions in the U.K. following last summer's security alert have lengthened passenger screening times and prompted many fliers to fly direct to other European airports and bypass Heathrow. Around a third of BA's long-haul business at the London airport is transfer traffic although this has fallen of late, Stinnes said.   Dublin-based Ryanair, the fast expanding Irish budget airline, meanwhile reported an 18% rise in seats sold to 4.35 million. The company is taking delivery of a net 30 new planes this year and has indicated it may have to discount fares this summer to fill its planes amid tough competition.   NCB Stockbrokers said the yield - or pricing - environment remains challenging for Ryanair, primarily due to softness in the U.K. market. It has a buy rating.   Ryanair's shares were up EUR0.05, or 0.9%, at EUR5.14.     Company Web sites: http://www.ba.com                        http://www.ryanair.com     -By Rod Stone, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 207 842 9295; rod.stone@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:23 ET (15:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MARKET TALK: Robert Wiseman Trading Robust - Oriel
Story: 0738 GMT [Dow Jones] Robert Wiseman's (RWD.LN) update indicates robust trading, says Darren Shirley at Oriel Securities. Notes volumes are in line with his expectations, and highlight the group's strong progress in its branded products range. Warns, however, the high-density polyethylene costs have risen further since its May prelims and could put pressure on forecasts if retained at current levels. Reiterates buy rating. Trades -0.5% at 520p. Headline: German Electrical, Electronic Indus Sees Growth Of 6% In 2007
Story: FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--The German electrical and electronics industry association ZVEI said Thursday it had raised its growth forecast for 2007 to 6% from a previously predicted range of 5% to 6%.   ZVEI said it now expects the industry's sales to total EUR190 billion in 2007.   "The most recent data confirm the positive business climate," Gotthard Grass, the ZVEI's head, said. "It's very likely that the industry will grow 5% to the EUR200 billion mark in 2008."   In 2007, the industry will continue to hire employees and ZVEI said it is expecting the labor force to grow to 815,000 from 806,500 at the last count.   ZVEI added that it had revised 2006 industry growth to 8.5% from 7.5%.     Company Web site: http://www.zvei.org     -By Roman Kessler, Dow Jones Newswires, +4969 2971 5514, roman.kessler@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 09:56 ET (13:56 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: M&S Bows To Shareholders Over CEO, Execs Bonus - Newspaper
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Marks & Spencer Group PLC (MAKSY) has bowed to shareholder pressure and modified the terms of its controversial bonus scheme for Stuart Rose, its chief executive, and other top directors at the high street retailer, The Times reports in London Wednesday   The report says, without citing sources, that it's understood that after meetings with the Association of British Insurers, M&S has increased the earnings-per-share targets that determine the level of performance-related payouts for Rose and other executives.   The ABI, a powerful shareholder lobby group, was happy to wave through a bumper cash-and-shares payout for Rose worth GBP7.8 million this year, but it insisted that in order to qualify for the same payout next year, earnings per share must rise by 12% above inflation. M&S had sought an increase of 10%.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.timesonline.co.uk     -London Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0)20 7842 9320     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:57 ET (05:57 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Platmin Appoints Executive Director And Chief Strategy Officer>PPN.T
Story: TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - Platmin Limited ("Platmin" or "the Company"; TSX / AIM: PPN) today announces with immediate effect the appointment of a new Executive Director to its board of directors, Mr. Kwape David Mmela. Mr. Mmela also holds the position of Chief Strategy Officer for the Platmin group.    Mr. Mmela is qualified with B.Proc and LLB degrees. He joined Boynton Investments (Pty) Ltd. ("Boynton", Platmin's operating subsidiary in South Africa) in 2006 with his key areas of focus including new business development and stakeholder relations. Platmin's lead black economic empowerment ("BEE") partner Moepi Platinum (Pty) Ltd (formerly named Moepi Capital (Pty) Ltd. "Moepi Platinum") was established by Mr. Mmela, where he is currently the chairman. He previously held the position of manager for socio-economic development, mineral and land rights at Anglo Platinum and was an adviser to the Constitutional Assembly during the drafting of South Africa's final constitution. Mr. Mmela previously held the position of Land Claims Officer at the Department of Land Affairs responsible for the resolution of land claims in two of South Africa's provinces.    "The addition of Mr. Mmela strengthens Platmin's management team, furthering our understanding and strategic approach to BEE matters." said Mr. Watson, CEO. "Mr. Mmela's addition to the board of directors of Platmin positions the Company to advance its BEE strategy with Moepi Platinum as its cornerstone BEE partner with Moepi Platinum currently holding direct and indirect interest in Boynton of 13.55%" he added.    Mr. Mmela is currently a director of the following companies:    Moepi Group (Pty) Ltd.;    Moepi Platinum (Pty) Ltd.;    Moepi Chrome (Pty) Ltd.;    Moepi Coal (Pty) Ltd.;    Boynton Investments (Pty) Ltd.; and    Ledima Investments (Pty) Ltd.    Platmin confirms there are no other matters requiring disclosure in relation to Rule 17 and Schedule 2(g) of the AIM Rules.    About Platmin    Platmin is a TSX and AIM (PPN) listed exploration and development company focused on its four key project areas: Pilanesberg, M'Phatlele, Grootboom, and Loskop on which PGM mineral resources have been estimated. All of Platmin's projects are located in the Bushveld Complex of South Africa, which region is estimated to contain approximately 90% of global platinum resources.          <<                                 www.platmin.com      >>      This release contains forward-looking statements contained that are not historical facts. Forward-looking statements involve risks, uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual results, performance, prospects and opportunities to differ materially from those expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements. Forward looking statements in this release include, but are not limited to the success of or the successful implementation of Platmin's BEE strategy. Factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from these forward-looking statements include, in addition to those risk set out in Platmin's prospectus dated July 28, 2006 and Platmin's Annual Information Form dated May 29, 2007 available at www.sedar.com and the timing of receipt of various regulatory approvals. Headline: Siemens Has Opened VDO Books To Potential Buyers -Sources -3
Story: Kaeser said the company is considering the release of unaudited third-quarter results for VDO earlier than usual, in order for the figures to be included in the IPO prospectus. Siemens' third-quarter figures are due July 26. The compilation and approval of an IPO prospectus usually takes several weeks.   Siemens said at the end of January that an IPO will likely involve the placement of 25% to 49% of VDO's share capital.   If Siemens should decide on an IPO, the company plans to complete the process in the current business year, which means before September 30. Even after an IPO, Siemens plans to retain a majority interest in VDO.   Siemens has repeatedly said that an IPO is preferred to a sale. Analysts note, however, that Siemens recently seemed increasingly open to a sale.   Former CEO Klaus Kleinfeld told analysts that the new supervisory board chairman Gerhard Cromme is keeping open all future options "that generate value" for VDO.   Two weeks ago, immediately after Siemens announced its IPO plans for VDO, Continental's Chief Financial Officer Alan Hippe said the company has made an indicative bid for VDO of around EUR10 billion, adding due diligence would be needed for a binding offer.     Company Web site: http://www.siemens.com     -By Alexander Becker, Michael Brendel, Simon Steiner; Dow Jones Newswires; +49 69 29 725 500; alexander.becker@dowjones.com.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:19 ET (15:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Chile Collahuasi Ups Offer, Workers Not Satisfied -Union
Story: SANTIAGO (Dow Jones)--Management at Chilean copper mine Dona Ines de Collahuasi has improved its contract offer during mediated negotiations, but workers aren't satisfied with the offer yet, a union leader said Wednesday.   The company is now offering a 3.5% wage increase, a 4,800,000 Chilean peso ($9,134) copper-price bonus and several other bonuses, but workers are seeking an 8.0% wage hike and a CLP12 million bonus, Collahuasi union president Hernan Farias said in a telephone interview.   "It's still well below what we're asking for," Farias said, adding that talks are scheduled to continue later Wednesday.   "But at the rate we're advancing, this won't be resolved anytime soon," he said.   Last week, workers voted in favor of a strike. The company then sought a five-day government mediated period, pushing back the strike start date to July 9.   "This looks like it's going to be resolved through a strike," Farias said, explaining that one of the sticking points was the formula to calculate the bonus based on production goals.   The union will hold a general assembly Saturday, when union leaders plan on informing members of the advances in negotiations and likely hold a vote on the latest offer, according to Farias.   Collahuasi is a joint venture between Xstrata PLC (XTA.LN) and Anglo American PLC (AAUK), each with a 44% stake. The remaining 12% is held by a Japanese consortium headed by Mitsui & Co. (MITSY).     -By Carolina Pica, Dow Jones Newswires; 56-2-460-8544; carolina.pica@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 09:30 ET (13:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Credit Agricole Interested In Intesa Sanpaolo Branches
Story: PARIS (Dow Jones)--Credit Agricole (4507.FR) Wednesday confirmed that it has submitted a bid for some or all of the branches put up for sale by Italy's Intesa Sanpaolo SpA (ISP.MI), a spokesman for the French bank told Dow Jones Newswires.   "I can confirm we're interested in the file," Alain Berry of Credit Agricole said. But he added: "I can't say in which manner we are," leaving open the option that the bank may make an offer for only some of the 198 branches up for sale.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:00 ET (14:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Barclays CEO: ABN Amro Bid Documents Filed In 49 Countries
Story: Edited press release   LONDON (Dow Jones)--John Varley, group chief executive of Barclays PLC (BCS), said Wednesday that his bank has filed precompletion regulatory filings in 49 countries in regard to its offer for ABN Amro Holdings NV (ABN).   "We have made pre-completion regulatory and competition authority filings in 49 jurisdictions globally," Varley said in a statement.   "The progress which Barclays and ABN Amro have made with these filings continues to demonstrate the straightforward nature of the Barclays offer. This gives ABN Amro shareholders a high degree of certainty and deliverability."   "We look forward to issuing our formal offer documentation to shareholders later this month.   "We believe that the combination of Barclays and ABN Amro will create sustained long-term value for shareholders by giving customers around the world access to significantly enhanced product and service capabilities."   -London bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 207 842 9294.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:17 ET (09:17 GMT)

Headline: : S&P: Rexam Plan To Buy Rostar Has No Rtg Impact
Story: The following is a press release from Standard & Poor's:     FRANKFURT (Standard & Poor's) July 4, 2007--Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said today that its ratings and outlook on U.K. based packaging company Rexam PLC (BBB/Negative/A-3) are unaffected by an announcement that the company will acquire Russia-based beverage-can producer Rostar for $297 million (GBP149 million). We view the acquisition as relatively neutral to Rexam's business risk profile. A negative impact on the financial risk profile will be mitigated by Rexam's recently completed subordinated bond issue of EUR750 million, proceeds of about EUR660 million from the disposal of its Glass business, as well as proceeds from a GBP286 million equity issue. Credit measures are, however, expected to remain weak for the ratings over the near term. This also means that the ratings could be lowered if any further acquisitions are funded in such a way that prevents the necessary recovery in credit measures.   Primary Credit Analyst: Alf Stenqvist, Stockholm (46) 8-440-5925;                  alf_stenqvist@standardandpoors.com Secondary Credit Analyst: Izabela Listowska, Frankfurt (49) 69-33-999-127;                    izabela_listowska@standardandpoors.com Additional   Contact: Industrial Ratings Europe;              CorporateFinanceEurope@standardandpoors.com     Analytic services provided by Standard & Poor's Ratings Services (" Ratings Services ") are the result of separate activities designed to preserve the independence and objectivity of ratings opinions. The credit ratings and observations contained herein are solely statements of opinion and not statements of fact or recommendations to purchase, hold, or sell any securities or make any other investment decisions. Accordingly, any user of the information contained herein should not rely on any credit rating or other opinion contained herein in making any investment decision. Ratings are based on information received by Ratings Services. Other divisions of Standard & Poor's may have information that is not available to Ratings Services. Standard & Poor's has established policies and procedures to maintain the confidentiality of non-public information received during the ratings process.   Ratings Services receives compensation for its ratings. Headline: : Pinetree Capital Ltd. Announces Appointment Of New Director>PNP.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - July 4, 2007) -    Pinetree Capital Ltd. ("Pinetree" or the "Company") (TSX:PNP) is pleased to announce the appointment of Peter Harder, LL.D., M.A., B.A. (Hons.), to its board of directors, following the retirement of Dr. Joseph Greenberg from the board.    Peter Harder is presently Senior Policy Advisor to the law firm, Fraser Milner Casgrain LLP, prior to which, he was the longest serving Deputy Minister in the Government of Canada. First appointed in 1991, Mr. Harder served as the most senior public servant in a number of federal departments including the Treasury Board, Solicitor General, Citizenship and Immigration, Industry and Foreign Affairs and International Trade. At Foreign Affairs, Mr. Harder assumed the responsibilities of the Personal Representative of the Prime Minister to three G8 Summits (Sea Island, Gleneagles and St. Petersburg). Mr. Harder also served as the Co-Chair of the Canada-China Strategic Working Group.    Sheldon Inwentash, Pinetree's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, stated: "We are very pleased to have Peter join our board. His insight and global perspective will contribute greatly to our dynamic board of directors. We would also like to recognize and thank Dr. Greenberg for his significant service and commitment to Pinetree and Genevest Inc., its predecessor, over the last 10 years." Dr. Greenberg has been appointed as a Director Emeritus of the Corporation.    About Pinetree    Pinetree Capital Ltd. ("Pinetree" or the "Company") was incorporated under the laws of the Province of Ontario and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange ("TSX") under the symbol "PNP" and is included in the Standard & Poor's/Toronto Stock Exchange composite index. Pinetree is a diversified investment and merchant banking firm focused on the small cap market. Pinetree's investments are primarily in the resources sector: Uranium, Oil & Gas, Precious Metals and Base Metals. Pinetree's investment approach is to build a macro position in a sector, find the micro-cap opportunities in that sector and work with those companies to build them to commercial production and create an exit.    For more details about Pinetree and its investments, please visit our website at www.pinetreecapital.com. Headline: : Essential Energy Services Trust Announces Closing Of Acquisition Of Assets And Businesses Of Four Private Energy Service Companies>ESN.UN.T
Story: CALGARY, ALBERTA--(CCNMatthews - July 4, 2007) - Essential Energy Services Trust (TSX:ESN.UN) ("Essential" or the "Trust") is pleased to announce the completion of the acquisition of the assets and businesses of four private companies for aggregate cash consideration of $22.3 million. The funds required were drawn from the proceeds of the previously announced $34.5 million bought-deal financing which closed on June 13, 2007. The Trust's intention to close these acquisitions was previously announced in conjunction with the disclosure of the financing. It is expected that these companies will add $5.8 million in incremental annualized earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization and stock-based compensation ("EBITDAC"). This results in an aggregate purchase multiple of enterprise value to EBITDAC of 3.8x.    The four companies include;    - Anderson Well Servicing (1986) Ltd. ("Anderson") - Anderson operates a fleet of eight hot oilers from Grande Prairie, Alberta. The operations of Anderson will be merged with Essential's Cascade Services operation and results in Essential operating a total fleet of 23 hot oilers which are versatile trucks able to provide oil or chemicals at high temperature and pressure as required for maintenance of producing oil and gas wells and facilities. The demand for hot oilers is strong and growing and Essential is now the largest supplier of these services in northern Alberta and northeast British Columbia.    - Blue-Vac Vacuum Truck Service ("Blue-Vac") - Blue-Vac operates 13 vacuum trucks and three sour gas scrubber units from Taber in southern Alberta. Blue-Vac will be integrated with Essential's Jacar operations that are also based in Taber and greatly expands the range of complimentary Transport services offered by Essential in this key operational area.    - Canadian Coil Tubing Inc. ("CCT") - CCT operates four new coil tubing units from Strathmore, Alberta immediately east of Calgary. CCT will be integrated with Essential's Kodiak Coil Tubing operations and will result in Essential operating a total of 25 coil tubing units across southern Alberta and southwest Saskatchewan.    - Redneck Flushbys Ltd ("Redneck") - Redneck operates four flushby's and one swab rig from Forestburg in central Alberta and will be merged with Essential's Cardinal Well Services ("Cardinal") operation which increases Essential's fleet of rod rigs and flushby's to 20 and increases the swab rig fleet to eight. Through Cardinal, Essential now operates one of the largest fleets of rod rigs and flushby's in central and southern Alberta. These are small, light and efficient service rigs specifically designed to service pumping oil wells. These rigs are in strong demand across western Canada's conventional oilfields.    The operations of these four private companies are being absorbed by existing Essential operations and will provide immediate incremental cash flow with no additional corporate personnel or resources required. "The addition of the assets of these four excellent companies, their strong customer relationships and outstanding personnel will expand and strengthen Essential's operations in key operating areas," said James Burns, President and CEO of Essential. Key management personnel from these companies will be joining the Essential team to further strengthen operations.    Essential is currently finalizing one additional previously disclosed acquisition and anticipates closing this transaction in July 2007. Several other potential acquisitions are also being evaluated.    Essential is an energy service trust that provides a range of essential production services to oil and gas producers across western Canada from northeast British Columbia to southwest Saskatchewan including service rigs, coil tubing, rod rigs, swab rigs, vacuum trucks, pressure trucks, tank trucks, hydro-vacs, steaming and hot oiling along with other related services. Essential focuses on post drilling production maintenance and enhancement services to ensure stable cash flows for Essential unitholders.    Non-GAAP Measures: Information set forth in this press release contains references to certain financial measures that do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by Canadian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and may not be comparable to similar measures presented by other companies or trusts. These financial measures are identified and defined below:    EBITDAC is defined as earnings before, interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization and stock-based compensation expense. We believe EBITDAC is a useful supplemental earnings measure as it provides an indication of the financial results generated by our principal business activities prior to consideration of how these activities are financed or how the results are taxed in various jurisdictions and before non-cash amortization expenses and non-cash stock-based compensation expense.    Forward-Looking Statements: Certain information set forth in this press release, including a discussion of future plans and operations, contains forward looking statements that involve substantial known and unknown risks and uncertainties. These forward-looking statements are subject to numerous risks and uncertainties, some of which are beyond management's control, including but not limited to, the impact of general economic conditions, industry conditions, fluctuation of commodity prices, fluctuation of foreign exchange rates, environmental risks industry competition, availability of qualified personnel and management, stock market volatility, timely and cost effective access to sufficient capital from internal and external sources. Actual results, performance or achievement could differ materially from those expressed in or implied by these forward-looking statements.    The TSX Exchange has not reviewed and does not accept responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release. Headline: Brazil Elec Power Agency Orders AES Eletropaulo To Cut Rates
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Brazil's Electric Energy Agency, or Aneel, required Eletropaulo Metropolitana Eletricidade de Sao Paulo (ELPL5.BR), or AES Eletropaulo, to lower low-voltage residential distribution rates by 12.66% and reduce high-voltage rates for industrial users by 10.45% as of Wednesday.   The rate cut is part of an overall revision of tariffs conducted every four years. The reduction in revenue, which is estimated at 8.4%, was made to take into account lower costs. The main factor is lower average capital costs for Brazil's largest electric energy distributor, said Aneel in a statement.   The tariff cut is still provisional and could be subject to some changes.   AES Corp (AES) owns AES Eletropaulo, as well as distributor AES Sul and generators AES Tiete and AES Uruguaiana.     -By Alastair Stewart; Dow Jones Newswires; 5511 3145-1479; alastair.stewart@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 09:20 ET (13:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: A-TEC Industries Plans Debut Hybrid Bond Issue
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Austria's A-TEC Industries has hired Dresdner Kleinwort and UniCredit to lead manage an inaugural hybrid bond issue, one of the lead managers said Wednesday.   The euro-denominated transaction is expected to price, subject to market conditions, after pan-European roadshows, which are scheduled to begin Monday. The roadshows are expected to last a week, and pricing is expected to take place the week after, the lead manager said.   The proposed hybrid bond issue will most likely carry a deeply subordinated perpetual structure and be non-callable for seven years, according to pre-deal research on the transaction sent out to investors Wednesday.   There were no details on what size the hybrid would be.   The hybrid bond will provide the group with further financial flexibility for acquisitions while not diluting the current ownership structure, according to the pre-deal research.   A-TEC is an industrial holding company with operations in the fields of plant construction, drive technologies, mechanical engineering and metallurgy.   A-TEC was floated on the Vienna stock exchange at the end of 2006, raising about EUR160 million, which was used to repay existing debt, fund future growth and for general corporate purposes, according to the pre-deal research.     -By Kate Haywood and Anousha Sakoui, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0) 20 7842 9315; kate.haywood@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:38 ET (14:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Siemens Has Opened VDO Books To Potential Buyers - Sources
Story: By Simon Steiner, Michael Brendel and Alexander Becker   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--Germany's Siemens AG (SI) has opened the books of its automotive unit VDO to potential buyers, people familiar with the matter told Dow Jones Newswires Wednesday.   The supervisory board will discuss further proceedings regarding VDO at its meeting on July 25, one day before the release of third-quarter results, the people said.   According to people familiar with the supervisory board, it will decide at the meeting on the official start of the unit's initial public offering process. In addition, the board is to consider a "dual track process," in which it may also negotiate with potential buyers of a stake in the subsidiary, the people said.   As of two weeks ago, both Siemens and Continental AG (CON.XE), which is interested in buying VDO, said the books were still closed.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 09:50 ET (13:50 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Brazil Bovespa: June Net Foreign Outflows Reach BRL2.08 Bln
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--The Brazilian Stock Exchange, or Bovespa, had a net outflow from foreign investors in June of 2.08 billion Brazilian reals ($1.1 billion), Bovespa said Wednesday.   Outflows in June could be attributed in large part to a shift prompted by European steel giant Arcelor Mittal's (MT) buyout offer for the outstanding shares of its local unit, Arcelor Brasil (ARCE3.BR).   Arcelor Mittal's BRL10.3 billion offer was completed in mid-June. About BRL1.5 billion of the total represented the stake held by foreign investors.   "The outflow in June did not represent a lack of interest in Brazil by foreign investors," said Alvaro Bandeira, director of Rio de Janeiro-based brokerage Agora Senior. "Along with the Arcelor movement, foreign investors also placed a portion of their money into local initial public share offerings by local companies."   Bovespa does not count foreign investments from new share offerings. In June, local companies raised a total of BRL6.9 billion through primary and secondary offers, according to the Brazilian Securities Commission, or CVM.   Foreign investors acquired more than 70% of local share offerings, according to banks involved in the IPOs. In the first half, foreign investment showed a net outflow of BRL136.6 million. For the full year 2006, Bovespa had a net inflow by foreign investors of BRL1.75 billion.   Foreign investors represented 35.6% of all transactions on the Bovespa during June, compared with 34.1% in April. In the first six months of 2007, foreign investors accounted for 34.5% of Bovespa transactions. In addition, Bovespa handled record trading volume in June. Total trading volume reached BRL105.2 billion, up from BRL87.3 billion in May.   The average daily volume in June was BRL5.26 billion, up from BRL3.9 billion seen in May. The benchmark Ibovespa index was up 4% in June at 54,392 points.   On Tuesday, Bovespa reported that the total market value of the 370 companies listed on the local exchange reached BRL2 trillion for the first time ever. In May the market value of listed companies was BRL1.9 trillion.   Brazil's largest company by market value is state-owned oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA (PBR), or Petrobras, which is worth BRL255 billion. Miner Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (RIO), or CVRD, is next, worth BRL205 billion. Private bank Itau SA (ITU) is worth BRL100.5 billion and its local rival, Bradesco SA (BBD) is worth BRL97.5 billion.     -By Rogerio Jelmayer, Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145 1480; rogerio.jelmayer@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:29 ET (14:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Skanska Sells Office Project In Copenhagen To Norrporten
Story: Edited Press Release     STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--Skanska said Wednesday it is selling the Havneholmen Atrium property in Copenhagen.   The purchaser is the real estate company Norrporten, which will take over the property when it is completed during the second quarter of 2008.   In accordance with Skanska's information policy the purchase price or capital gain is not disclosed for commercial development projects under construction.   The development gain will be reported in the quarterly reports as project completion progresses.   The property comprises 12,500 square meters of office space. The project was started in the second quarter 2006 and is currently under construction. Skanska's investment amounts to approximately SEK370 million.   About 80% of the property is currently leased. Leases have been signed with Handelsbanken, Ahlbins and BDO ScanRevision. Negotiations concerning the remaining space are under way with a number of prospective tenants.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 03:07 ET (07:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE:Intesa Sanpaolo To Buy 19.9% Of Qingdao Bank -Sources
Story: (Adds information on Qingdao City Commercial Bank and Intesa Sanpaolo.)     By Rick Carew   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     BEIJING (Dow Jones)--Italian bank Intesa Sanpaolo SpA (ISP.MI) will sign an agreement next week to take a 19.9% stake in China's Qingdao City Commercial Bank, people familiar with the situation said Wednesday.   Intesa Sanpaolo, formed last year by the merger of Banca Intesa and Sanpaolo IMI, joins the ranks of foreign banks taking stakes in Chinese lenders to tap the rapidly growing Chinese market for financial services. China's financial sector is still largely dominated by banks, which are seeking international partners to improve their risk management and product lines.   International Finance Corp., the World Bank's private investment arm, may also take a 5% stake in the Chinese bank, but that investment hasn't been finalized, one person close to the deal said.   Qingdao City Commercial Bank, founded in 1996, is 52%-owned by affiliates of Chinese white goods manufacturer Haier Group. The bank has 39 outlets and over 800 employees in the coastal city best known for the beer brand Tsingtao Beer. Tsingtao is an alternative spelling of the city's name.   Total foreign investment in a Chinese domestic bank is capped at 25%, with a single foreign investor being allowed no more than 20%.   A 19.9% stake would be valued around CNY1.04 billion ($137 million), according to a Dow Jones Newswires calculation based on the pricing of a private placement that Qingdao City Commercial Bank is conducting and assuming the Italian bank is a participant in the placement.   Shenzhen-listed Qingdao Kingking Applied Chemistry Co. (002094.SZ) said in a stock exchange statement dated June 28 that Qingdao City Commercial Bank was placing 900 million new shares to both foreign and local investors at CNY2.60 each and it would buy 20 million of the shares. The statement also said Qingdao City Commercial Bank's share capital before the placement totaled 1.1 billion shares.   The people familiar with Intesa Sanpaolo's deal, however, declined to discuss pricing or whether it was part of the private placement.   Intesa Sanpaolo Chief Executive Corrado Passera said in late June that the Italian bank was considering buying a stake in Qingdao City Commercial Bank.   Milan-based Intesa Sanpaolo's global reach consists of offices in 10 countries worldwide, mainly in central and Eastern Europe. It has recently expanded its operations in Egypt by acquiring a majority stake of Egyptian lender Bank of Alexandria. The bank owns Itay's largest retail network with over 5,500 branches in its home market.   IFC has previously disclosed it was seeking approval from its board to take a 5% stake in the coastal city lender.     -By Rick Carew, Dow Jones Newswires; 8610 6588-5848; rick.carew@dowjones.com   (Sabrina Cohen in Milan contributed to this story.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:01 ET (10:01 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: EU Fines Telefonica EUR151.9M For Broadband Abuses
Story: (Updates an item that ran at 1211 GMT with further details, competitors' comments)     BRUSSELS (Dow Jones)--The European Commission Wednesday fined Spain's Telefonica SA (TEF) EUR151.9 million, saying the telecommunications giant used its grip on the country's telephone network to hamper rival broadband providers.   Telefonica squeezed its competitors' margins by raising fees for access to its telephone network and lowering its own prices for retail broadband services, the commission said in a statement.   Telefonica was "making it virtually impossible for competitors to enter the market," the commission's top antitrust official, Neelie Kroes, told a news conference.   The commission's penalty, its highest ever against a telecommunications company, is part of a broader effort to shake up the sector, which is still dominated by former state-owned monopolies. Over the past year, the regulator has pressed operators to lower mobile phone roaming charges and has pushed for changes in several broadband markets. The commission last week took Germany to court for giving Deutsche Telekom AG (DT) a legal monopoly over the country's broadband network.   Telefonica's fine shows how the regulator is escalating its crackdown on antitrust abuses by levying heftier fines. In similar cases in 2003, Wanadoo, the Internet arm of France Telecom (FTE), was fined EUR10.4 million and Deutsche Telekom was penalized EUR12.6 million. In a range of recent collusion cases, fines have been several times larger than in comparable cases just a few years ago.    Kroes said Telefonica's fine was justified because of the seriousness of the abuse and the harm done to consumers. Spanish broadband customers pay 20% more than the average price in the 15 oldest E.U. member countries and Spain's broadband penetration rate is 20% lower than average, according to the commission.   Telefonica said it will appeal the fine, calling the commission's penalty "unjustified and disproportionate." It added that it has complied with rules established by Spain's telecommunications regulator.    "Telefonica finds itself squeezed between two regulators, the national regulator and the European Commission, which are at odds with each other," the company said in a statement.     Telefonica said its share of Spain's broadband market has decreased steadily to its current 55% from 95% in 2001. The company's main competitors for broadband services include Orange, a unit of France Telecom, and Jazztel PLC (JAZ.MC). Orange first complained to the commission about Telefonica's business practices in 2003.   The commission's fine "confirms the validity of Orange's (complaint)," Orange said in a statement. A spokesman for Jazztel declined to comment.   Being a former state-owned monopoly helped Telefonica rig Spain's broadband market, according to the commission. About 80% of high-speed Internet connections in Spain are made over fixed telephone lines. Telefonica, which was privatized in 1997, is the only Spanish telecommunications company with a nationwide fixed-line network.   Telefonica's business plan and cost accounts show that the company "could not have been unaware that it was engaging in a margin squeeze," the E.U. regulator said. Between September 2001 and December 2006, the margin between Telefonica's retail prices and the fees it charged for network access was too thin for other providers to cover their costs, the commission added.   The commission opened a formal investigation into Telefonica's business practices in February 2006. That prompted Spain's telecommunications authority to force the company to lower its wholesale prices in December 2006, ending the company's antitrust abuses, according to the commission.     -By Adam Cohen, Dow Jones Newswires; +322 741 1486; adam.cohen@dowjones.com   (Peppi Kiviniemi and Jason Sinclair contributed to this article)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 08:26 ET (12:26 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : SR Telecom Receives C$45M Financing: New Term Loan Supported By Existing Shareholders>SRX.T
Story: MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(CCNMatthews - July 3, 2007) - SR Telecom Inc. (TSX:SRX) today announced that it has entered into an agreement with a syndicate of lenders comprised of shareholders and lenders of the Company providing for a term loan of up to $45.0 million, of which $35.0 million was drawn today and an additional $10.0 million will be available for drawdown for a period of up to one year from closing, subject to certain conditions. The term loan has a five-year term and is subject to the same security as the existing loans under the Company's existing credit facility, but ranking senior to the existing loans. The term loan bears cash interest at a rate equal to the greater of 6.5% or the three-month US dollar LIBOR rate plus 3.85% and additional interest that may be paid in cash or in kind, at the option of the Company, at a rate equal to the greater of 7.5% or the three-month US dollar LIBOR rate plus 4.85%. The cash portion of the interest will be payable in kind until December 2008. A payout fee of 5% of the term loan will be paid to lenders upon repayment or maturity of the loan.    "The level of support we have received today from our shareholders and lenders is a strong indication of their ongoing belief in SR Telecom, its people, its products and its WiMAX strategy," said Serge Fortin, SR Telecom's President and Chief Executive Officer. "While it is clear that much remains to be done for SR Telecom to regain positive and sustainable momentum, these additional funds will enable us to execute on our growth strategy even though the delay in finalizing today's announcement has had a negative impact on manufacturing schedules and deliveries, and will have an unfavourable effect on second and third quarter results."    Amendments to terms    In connection with entering into this new term loan, the syndicate of lenders has agreed to amend some of the terms of the initial advances under the credit facility and the convertible term loan. The maturity date has been amended to match the maturity date of this new financing and the cash portion of the interest will be payable in kind until December 2008.    In addition, amendments were also made to the terms of the credit facility and the convertible term loan for the portion of the debt held by two of the lenders, who are not Company insiders, whereby their respective portions would be convertible into common shares of the Company at a price of $0.114 per share. As well, the conversion price of the portion of the convertible term loan held by one of the lenders was amended to the same price.    As some of the parties participating in the financing are related parties of the Company, as defined by applicable securities legislation in Quebec and Ontario, the financing is considered a related-party transaction. However, it is exempt from the valuation and minority approval requirements, as it is a loan to the Company obtained on reasonable commercial terms that are no less advantageous to the Company than if the loan had been obtained from persons that were dealing at arm's length with the Company.    The Company will file a material change report less than 21 days prior to the closing date of the financing, a shorter period that is reasonable and necessary under the circumstances, which will allow the Company to complete the transaction in a timely manner in order to finance its operations and execute on its growth strategy.    Status update on results    The Company intends to update its financial statements and accompanying management's discussion and analysis for the periods ended December 31, 2006 and March 31, 2007 in the coming days.    About SR Telecom    SR Telecom (TSX:SRX) is a recognized global leader in delivering innovative broadband wireless access (BWA) solutions that enable service providers to efficiently deploy quality voice, Internet and next-generation services in urban, suburban and remote areas. A technological pioneer with more than 25 years of experience in wireless networking, SR Telecom is the only BWA vendor with extensive real-world expertise in deploying the advanced features of the WiMAX standard. It actively promotes standards-based BWA networking through its role as a principal member of the WiMAX Forum.    With its primary offices in Montreal and Mexico City, SR Telecom is an agile, customer-focused organization with a proven track record. SR Telecom's products are currently deployed in more than 110 countries worldwide. For more information, visit www.srtelecom.com. Headline: Computer Error Leads To Wrong Payments For Ex-Enron Workers
Story: HOUSTON (AP)--More than 20,000 former Enron Corp. (ENE) employees who finally received the first payment from a portion of millions in retirement funds lost during the company's collapse have been told they either were overpaid or underpaid because of a computer glitch.   Now some ex-workers might have to pay back money if they got too much.   Last year, former Enron workers received about $89 million, the first payment that is part of a lawsuit settlement over money they lost through Enron's employee stock ownership and 401(k) plans.   But nearly $22 million of the initial payment was miscalculated, said Harlan Loeb, spokesman for Enron, now known as Enron Creditors Recovery Corp.   About 7,700 ex-workers were overpaid, and about 12,800 were underpaid. But they won't know their fate until the recalculation is finished.   Enron is blaming the problem on Hewitt Associates Inc. (HEW), a Lincolnshire, Ill.-based company it hired to allocate the settlement proceeds.   A software program that Hewitt used to calculate payments used the wrong stock price, Loeb said.   "It certainly was a profound mistake," he said.   Maurissa Kanter, a spokeswoman for Hewitt, said the company is focused on "working diligently with Enron to ensure that this matter is resolved as soon as possible for the plan's participants and beneficiaries."   In court filings, Hewitt acknowledged the problem was "due to an undetected data error," but disputed Loeb's assertion that Hewitt was the fund administrator and thus was responsible for making sure funds were correctly distributed.   Enron and Hewitt are waiting for U.S. District Judge Melinda Harmon, who is overseeing the case, to rule on a motion by Enron asking that Hewitt redo its calculations and certify them and offer former workers a way to protest if they disagree with the new numbers.   The problems with the first settlement distribution could delay the next one, about $85 million.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 03:11 ET (07:11 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Belarus Plans $500M Worth Of Eurobonds In Autumn-Dep Fin Min
Story: By Lidia Kelly and Clare Connaghan   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MOSCOW (Dow Jones)--Belarus is planning to issue $500 million worth of Eurobonds in the autumn, First Deputy Finance Minister Andrei Kharkovets' told Dow Jones Newswires Wednesday.   "The currency in which the Eurobonds are denominated will be determined by market conditions," Kharkovets said.   He also confirmed that the country is in final stages of receiving a sovereign credit rating. He said the ministry is finalizing a report to the government based on findings from three rating agencies.   Last month, Russian state-owned OAO Vneshtorgbank said it was ready to act as lead manager for the issue.   It will be up to the Belorussian President Aleksander Lukashenko and the Council of Ministers to decide on making the credit rating public and future cooperation with the rating agencies, Kharkovets said.   President Alexander Lukashenko has ruled Belarus for over a decade, with a Soviet-style, centrally controlled economy and strong ties to Russia.   These ties were tested in January, when Russia cut off its crude oil exports to Europe via the Druzhba pipeline, or Friendship pipeline after Belarus imposed an import duty on oil shipped through pipelines across its territory.   Belarus eventually backed down, but the new arrangements could cost the country $3.5 billion a year, the Associated Press reported in late March.   According to the International Monetary Fund, real gross domestic product grew at a 12-month rate of 8.7% in the period January-April 2007, down from 10.5% in the corresponding period last year.   Last Friday, the Republic of Albania secured its debut sovereign ratings from Moody's Investors Service. Moody's assigned an issuer rating of B1 for its debt obligations and a Ba1 country rating for its foreign-currency bonds.     -By Lidia Kelly and Clare Connaghan, Dow Jones Newswires; +7 495 974 80 55; lidia.kelly@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 13:33 ET (17:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: EU Crt Rules Changes To SFR, Orange 3G Licenses Were Legal -2
Story: The court ruling saves SFR, the mobile arm of France Telecom (FTE), and Orange, jointly owned by Vivendi SA (12777.FR) and Vodafone Group PLC (VOD), from having to pay the French government about EUR4 billion apiece.   Orange and SFR in 2001 each paid the government EUR4.95 billion for their 3G licenses, enabling them to offer a range of new mobile services such as wireless data and video. The price of the licenses reflected the dot-com boom and widespread anticipation across Europe that 3G services would be widely used and immensely profitable.   After the internet bubble burst and mobile users proved slow to switch to 3G services, the French government decided that more than two 3G operators were needed to ensure effective competition. In 2002, it sold Bouygues a license for EUR619 million and a percentage of its profits. The government also changed the terms of Orange and SFR's licenses to match the Bouygues deal.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 04:03 ET (08:03 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : FortisBC Inc. Closes C$105M Deb Issue>FTS.T
Story: KELOWNA, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - July 4, 2007) -FortisBC Inc. ("FortisBC" or the "Company"), an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Fortis Inc. (TSX:FTS), announced today the closing of its $105 million debenture issue. The issue consists of 5.90% senior unsecured debentures (the "Debentures") due July 4, 2047. The underwriting syndicate for the issue was led by Scotia Capital Inc., and includes CIBC World Markets Inc. and National Bank Financial Inc.    FortisBC plans to use the net proceeds of the issue to repay certain existing indebtedness under its credit facilities, which was incurred primarily to fund capital expenditures. The balance of the proceeds is planned to be used for future capital expenditures and other general corporate purposes.    The Debentures have been rated BBB (high), stable trend, by DBRS Limited and Baa2, Stable Outlook, by Moody's Investors Service. The Debentures will bear interest at a rate of 5.90% per annum, payable semi-annually in arrears in equal instalments on January 4 and July 4 of each year, commencing on January 4, 2008. The Debentures will mature on July 4, 2047.    The Debentures have not been and will not be registered under the US Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and may not be offered or sold in the United States to any person absent registration or an applicable exemption from registration requirements. This news release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy the Debentures in the United States, nor shall there be any offer, solicitation, or sale of the Debentures in any state in which such offer, solicitation, or sale would be unlawful.    FortisBC is an integrated electric utility based in Kelowna, British Columbia and operating in the southern interior of British Columbia. The Company serves approximately 152,000 customers directly and indirectly. The utility has four regulated hydroelectric generating plants with a combined capacity of 235 megawatts and approximately 6,750 kilometers of transmission and distribution power lines. FortisBC employs over 570 people in British Columbia and is an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Fortis Inc., the largest investor-owned distribution utility in Canada, which serves almost 2,000,000 gas and electric customers and has approximately $10 billion of assets. The Common Shares, First Preference Shares, Series C, First Preference Shares, Series E and First Preference Shares, Series F of Fortis are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols FTS, FTS.PR.C, FTS.PR.E and FTS.PR.F, respectively. Fortis Inc. information can be accessed at www.fortisinc.com or www.sedar.com.
