Headline: Norway's Gassco Gets Consent To Use Langeled North Gas Pipe
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Norway's gas network operator Gassco has consent to use the northern section of the Langeled pipeline, which will bring gas from new Ormen Lange field to the U.K., Norway's Petroleum Safety Authority said Wednesday.   Jan Hauge, executive vice president of product management at Gassco, said the pipeline could now begin its commissioning phase. He couldn't comment on when testing would begin or how long it would last.   The pipeline, the Nyhamna gas processing plant and Ormen Lange platform will be tested by flowing gas in reverse direction from the Sleipner field to the south. This will allow testing to be conducted before Ormen Lange produces its first gas.   First commercial deliveries from Ormen Lange are scheduled to begin October 1 at an initial rate of 30 million cubic meters a day. Flows will ramp up to 50 mcm/day by April 2008, and eventually achieve plateau production of 70 mcm/day.   The pipeline from Ormen Lange will connect to the Nyhamna gas processing plant, then the Sleipner riser platform further to the south. It will deliver gas into the Easington gas terminal in Yorkshire in the U.K. The length of the pipeline is 1200 kilometers.   Ormen Lange developer Norsk Hydro ASA (NHY) will hand over operation of the field to Royal Dutch Shell PLC (RDSB.LN) in late November or early December this year.   Denmark's DONG Energy, ExxonMobil Corp. (XOM), Statoil ASA (STL.OS) and Norwegian state oil company Petoro ASA also have minority stakes in the project.   Company Web site: http://www.gassco.no     -By James Herron, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0)20 7842 9317; james.herron@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:35 ET (09:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Germany KfW Raises 2007 Refi Volume To EUR60B From EUR55B -2-
Story: KfW Banking Group offers low interest rate loans to German companies or citizens and every year issues an estimate of how much it needs to refinance these loans.   In the first five months of the year, the bank's divisions KfW Promotional Bank and KfW Small/Medium sized Enterprises Bank approved 14% more loans than in the corresponding period last year, Braeunig said.   "The pleasing economic growth in Germany is accompanied by increasing demand for (KfW's) promotional loans," he said.   Braeunig declined to comment on the privatization of Deutsche Post AG (DPW.XE) and Deutsche Telekom AG (DT), in which KfW holds stakes, saying the "political debate" on the issue hasn't finished yet.   He said, however, that there was nothing preventing KfW from selling its stakes in the two companies if and when it wanted. KfW owns a 16.9% stake in Deutsche Telekom and 30.6% of Deutsche Post.     KfW web Site: www.kfw.com     -By Christian Streckert, Dow Jones Newswires; +49 69 29 725 500; christian.streckert@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:21 ET (10:21 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Honda Hopes Redesigned Fit To Help Drive Japan Sales From 2H
Story: TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Honda Motor Co. (7267.TO) expects its domestic auto sales to improve from the fiscal second half when it rolls out the redesigned version of its popular Fit compact model, a Honda executive said Wednesday.   "The (domestic) market won't expand for the time being," said Manabu Nishimae, Honda's operating officer in charge of domestic operations.   But "we expect sales to pick up from the second half, mainly with the (new) Fit that we will introduce in the autumn," he told reporters after a press conference about Honda's new automobile communications services.   Japan's auto makers have been on a roll overseas but are facing tough times at home. Sales of new vehicles excluding mini vehicles of 660cc or less dropped to a 30-year low in the first six months through June, according to the Japan Automobile Dealers Association.   Honda, which is Japan's second-largest auto maker by sales volume, has seen its domestic sales fall for five straight months since the start of 2007. Its sales over that same period were down 7.6% from a year earlier.   For the fiscal year ending in March, the car maker aims to narrow the decline in its domestic sales to 1.8%, after a 3.4% fall last year. Honda's domestic sales remain important, accounting for 18% of its overall global sales last fiscal year.   Honda launched partly redesigned versions of the Fit and Life small-car models, as well as the Step Wagon minivan, by late June, and plans to launch the all-new Fit this autumn in Japan, Nishimae said.   The Fit was Japan's third best selling model in Japan in 2006 after Toyota Motor Corp.'s Corolla and the Vitz compact, also offered by Toyota.   As part of efforts to lure domestic customers, Honda Wednesday unveiled new automobile communications services, also called telematics services.   About 40% of Honda car buyers use its telematics services, and these services have helped retain customers,  Nishimae said.   The new services include a function that automatically updates, through a wireless communication device, its navigation-information maps with newly opened roads. Until now, users of its telematics services needed to go to a Honda dealership to download such data.   The auto maker will begin the new map-updating service when it launches the redesigned Fit.   Honda will also start offering new services that provide telematics users with earthquake and weather information for the areas in which they are driving.   Toyota began a similar automobile communication service in Japan in May that updates maps used in its telematics service.     -By Yoshio Takahashi, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; yoshio.takahashi@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 03:00 ET (07:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Toyota And Lexus Sales Sizzle In June
Story: TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - Toyota Canada Inc. (TCI) today announced its best June ever for both Toyota and Lexus sales. TCI set a new June sales record at 20,611 vehicles, with an increase of 11.3 per cent over the same month in 2006. TCI's best ever June powered the company's year-to-date total sales to a record first half - 105,779, up 6.1 per cent year over year.    In the first half of this year alone Canadians purchased 4,749 Toyota and Lexus hybrids, accounting for almost 30 per cent of the 17,047 hybrids that have been sold since TCI introduced the technology to this country seven years ago.    Canadians purchased 19,339 Toyota vehicles in June, up 12.1 per cent from June of last year.          <<      -   Toyota sold 14,116 passenger cars in June, up 6.7 per cent from the          same month in 2006 for the best ever June.        -   Toyota truck sales of 5,223 were up 29.8 per cent compared to the          same month in 2006 for the best ever June.        Lexus in Canada enjoyed its best ever June, as Canadian drivers purchased  1,272 Lexus cars and SUVs - up 0.5 per cent from June of last year to mark the  23rd consecutive monthly sales record for the luxury badge.        -   Lexus sold 870 luxury passenger cars in June 2007 - up 3.1 per cent          from the same month the previous year for the best-ever June.        -   Lexus sold 402 luxury SUVs in June, to bring year to date totals up          2 per cent over the same period last year.      >>      "We're very pleased that Canadians turn to Toyota when looking for a high-quality, fuel-efficient, low-emission automobile - or a capable and powerful pick-up truck," said Tony Wearing, Managing Director of TCI. "We're equally thrilled that Canadians continue to embrace our industry-leading range of hybrid vehicles."    "The relationship between Lexus and our guests is second to none, and we're pleased that so many Canadians choose to join the Lexus family each month," noted Stuart Payne, Director of Lexus in Canada. "June was no exception as we enjoyed our 23rd consecutive monthly sales record. Meantime, our low-emissions, high-performance hybrid vehicles - the GS 450h and RX 400h - continue to account for significant percentages of all GS and RX units sold."          <<      June sales highlights:        -   In June, Canadians bought 1,958 models of the Yaris with a Trunk, up          2 per cent from the same month last year, to set a new June record          for the model.        -   The Toyota Camry Hybrid sold 682 models and enjoyed its best ever          month of sales in June, a 150 per cent boost over the same month last          year. Proving hybrids are becoming an increasingly important choice          for Canadian drivers, the Camry Hybrid accounted for 24 per cent of          all Camrys sold in Canada last month.        -   The Canadian-built Matrix and Corolla continued to enjoy strong          sales. The Matrix set a new June record, selling 2,593 units (up          21.5 per cent versus June 2006), while Corolla sales were up          22.5 per cent over June of last year.        -   The Tundra (both 4x2 and 4x4) enjoyed its best ever June with a          combined 1,092 units sold, up 457 per cent versus June 2006. Year to          date sales of 4,958 are up 254 per cent over the previous year. The          Tundra 4x2 enjoyed its best month ever, with sales of 95 units, while          sales of 997 units established a new June record for Tundra 4x4.        -   Sales of Lexus hybrid luxury vehicles were strong, with the GS 450h          sedan accounting for 19 per cent of all GS series vehicles sold in          June. Likewise, the RX 400h SUV accounted for 22 per cent of all RX          series vehicles sold in June. To date this year, Lexus has sold 475          models of the RX 400h, up 19.9 per cent over the same six months of          2006.      >>               /CONTACT: Kathryn Ruhland, Manager, Public Relations, Toyota Canada Inc., (416) 431-8333, media@toyota.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 15:54 ET (19:54 GMT)

Headline: Siemens Has Opened VDO Books To Potential Buyers - Sources-2-
Story: Siemens continues to prepare for the public offering of VDO. The offer's critical phase should start on July 16 with an analyst presentation, some of the people said.   At the presentation, VDO management will provide information on the company to analysts from the banks that will manage its IPO. The presentation will result in IPO studies that will be used later at the road shows for the offering.   A Siemens spokesperson declined to comment on this information.   Contrary to what has been reported in the media, Siemens is sticking to its original plan to carry out the IPO after the summer break in September, the people said.   Several reports in the media had cited Chief Financial Officer Joe Kaeser as saying the IPO prospectus for VDO would already be available at the end of July, which would have implied an IPO before September, given that the subscription period normally starts immediately after the release of the prospectus.   A Siemens spokesman told Dow Jones Newswires that Kaeser was not referring to the VDO prospectus but to the IPO analyst presentation in his statements, adding that it would have been impossible to produce such a prospectus before the end of July. The spokesman clarified that the analyst presentation should be held at the latest at the end of July.   Normally, larger IPOs take place in the spring or after the holiday season, from the end of August onwards.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:29 ET (14:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Spain Energy Regulator OKs Acciona-Enel Bid For Endesa- Source -2-
Story: Acciona and Enel launched in April a joint takeover bid for Endesa at EUR41.30 per share, later lowered to EUR40.16 per share to adjust for a EUR1.14-a-share dividend paid by Endesa on July 2.   The bid, which values Endesa at EUR42.53 billion, must be approved by the CNE, and later by Spain's stock market regulator CNMV.   The bid follows the guidelines set on an agreement signed in March by both parties, just before Germany's E.ON AG (EON) withdrew an earlier, EUR40-a-share bid on April 2. E.ON agreed to step back from the bidding battle in exchange for the potential acquisition of a portfolio of assets across Europe.   Company Web site: http://www.endesa.com   -By David Roman, Dow Jones Newswires, 34 913958125, david.roman@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:43 ET (09:43 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MARKET TALK: Ryanair Seen Coping With Green Taxes... For Now
Story: 0917 GMT [Dow Jones] Higher cost airlines rather than low-cost carriers like Ryanair (RYAAY) will struggle most with "regressive" green passenger taxes proposed in the Netherlands and increases suggested for the UK, says Goodbody Stockbrokers. Headline: EU Fines Telefonica EUR151.9M For Abuses In Broadband Mkt -3-
Story: Telefonica's fine also shows that the commission is escalating its crackdown on antitrust abuses. In a similar case in 2003, Wanadoo, the Internet arm of France Telecom (FTE), was fined only EUR10.4 million. In a range of recent cartel cases, fines have been several times larger than in similar cases just a few years ago.   Fining Wanadoo helped pry open the French broadband market, the commission said, adding that the sector is now "among the most competitive in Europe, with lower prices" and a growing number of users.   In Spain, by contrast, broadband customers pay 20% more than the average price in the 15 oldest E.U. member countries. Spain's broadband penetration rate is also 20% lower than average, according to the commission.   Telefonica's business plan and cost accounts show that the company could not have been unaware that it was engaging in a margin squeeze, the commission said.   The commission opened a formal investigation into Telefonica's business practices in February 2006. That prompted Spanish regulators to force the company to lower its wholesale prices in December 2006, ending the company's antitrust abuses, according to the commission.     -By Adam Cohen, Dow Jones Newswires; +322 741 1486; adam.cohen@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:58 ET (09:58 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Honda Achieves Record June Sales
Story: TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - Honda's automobile division reported record June sales of 15,017 units, up 18 per cent, led by record sales of Civic and Fit. The Acura division posted a 4 per cent increase with sales of 1,890 units, powered by record sales of MDX. Honda Canada Inc. reported June sales of 16,907 units by its Honda and Acura divisions combined, up 16 per cent over last year.    Honda's record sales were fuelled by record June Civic sales of 7,857 units, up 31%, and by all-time record monthly sales of the fuel-efficient Fit subcompact of 1,863 units, up 33%.    "Canadians are clearly choosing the most balanced selection of fuel efficiency, safety and fun-to-drive performance in both the Honda Civic and Fit," said Jim Miller, executive vice president, Honda Canada Inc. "We are seeing strong response to the 'Honda Benefit' program that provides advantages for every consumer who can have confidence in Honda's products because they have chosen the best balance in the marketplace."    Acura's June sales were led by the new MDX luxury sport-utility vehicle with record sales of 497 units, up 82%.    Honda is the world's preeminent maker of engines for automobiles, motorcycles and power equipment. With 130 manufacturing facilities in 29 countries worldwide, Honda now attracts nearly 20 million customers annually. Honda Canada manufactures the Honda Ridgeline and Civic, and the Acura CSX and MDX at its two plants in Alliston, Ontario. A new, third plant in Alliston, with the capacity to produce up to 200,000 fuel-efficient 4-cylinder engines annually, is scheduled to open in 2008.             /CONTACT: Sandy Di Felice, (416) 453-6505     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 17:13 ET (21:13 GMT)

Headline: Toronto Stks Mixed At Midday On Light Volume -2-
Story: Overall, six of the TSX's 10 sectoral indexes were trading higher.   The biggest gainer was the materials group, which was up 1.06%. In the group, Alcan had risen 35 Canadian cents to C$89.18, while Teck Cominco had added 0.63 to 46.43 a day after making a friendly takeover bid for Aur Resources. Aur was up 0.13 to 41.69 after rising sharply Tuesday on news of Teck's bid. The bid is for C$41 a share or 0.8749 of a Teck Class B share for each Aur common share.   The telecom group had gained 0.94%, with Telus up 1.08 to 65.68 and BCE ahead 0.08 to 41.33. BCE has accepted a C$42.75-a-share buyout bid from an investor group led by Ontario Teachers Pension Plan, but there is speculation that Telus could make a competing offer. There is also speculation that Telus could itself become the subject of a bid fueled by private equity money.   Among other groups, the energy group was down 0.60%, the financial services group had fallen 0.40% and the information technology group was off 0.10%.     -Stuart Weinberg, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2026;     stuart.weinberg@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:59 ET (15:59 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Turkey's OIB OKs Izmir Port Sale To Global-Hutchison-EIB -IHA
Story: ANKARA (Dow Jones)--Turkish Privatization Agency, or OIB, said Wednesday it has approved the sale of the operating rights of State Railways' Aegean port of Izmir to Global-Hutchison-EIB Consortium for $1.275 billion, the Ihlas News Agency, or IHA reported.   According to a recent report in the Official Gazette, if Global-Hutchison-EIB Consortium doesn't fulfill its obligations, operating rights will be handed over to Turkish Celebi Holding A.S., the company that submitted the second highest bid of $1.27 billion in the privatization tender.   In early May, a joint venture of Hong Kong's Hutchison, Turkish investment-brokerage firm Global Yatirim Holding (GLYHO.IS) and Turkey's Aegean Exporters Association, or EIB, Port Services and Transportation Co.; submitted the highest bid of $1.275 billion for the 49-years operating rights of Izmir port, in a privatization tender.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 04:16 ET (08:16 GMT)

Headline: FOCUS: Tire Makers To Benefit From Soaring Aircraft Demand
Story: By David Pearson   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     PARIS (Dow Jones)--Commercial aircraft builders Airbus and Boeing Co. (BA) aren't the only ones rubbing their hands over the surge in orders for passenger jets.   The two airplane manufacturers have seen a surge of orders, with a total of 550 worth an estimated $77 billion in firm deals coming at last month's Paris Air Show alone. But tire makers such as Michelin SA (12126.FR) of France, Japan's Bridgestone Corp. (5108.TO), Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co. (GT) of the U.S. and Dunlop Aircraft Tyres Ltd. of the U.K. - like other aeronautical suppliers - stand to reap rich rewards from the production spike over the coming years.   Historically, the airframe construction industry has operated on a seven- to 10-year cycle, and most aviation industry analysts reckon that production could sputter in 2011 before picking up again in 2015.   But tire producers - unlike other suppliers - are shielded from the impact of an eventual downturn in airframe construction. That's because - as they do in the automobile or truck segments - they make a lot more money from replacement tires than from supplying original equipment to car and plane makers.   Accounting for about EUR500 million in annual sales, the aviation tire industry is tiny by comparison with the overall civil jetliner business, but it's growing at a robust rate of about 4% to 5% every year, in line with the rise in air traffic.   It's a lucrative one, too, though all tire manufacturers are coy about breaking out sales or profit data for their aviation businesses.   "That's sensitive information," said Francois Corbin, head of Michelin's aviation tires division, adding: "I'd be really interested to see my competitors' figures."   Eric Varndell, global marketing manager for Goodyear Aviation Tires, agreed. "It's quite a small industry, and any information is well guarded."   Michelin's SR3 business segment - which lumps together aviation and other specialty tires as well as maps and guides and sales of branded goods - saw a 4.1% rise in sales last year to just under EUR2 billion, but its operating margin of 12.4% was 50% better than that of its car tire operations, and almost double that of truck tires.   Goodyear gives regional breakdowns, but of its overall operations and not by business segment.   "I'd be very surprised if Michelin's aviation tire margins aren't greater than the average" of its SR3 segment, said Stephen Cheetham, automotive analyst at Sanford Bernstein in London, although he acknowledged that "it's very difficult to make sensible estimates" because Michelin and other companies keep their data so close to their chests.   Aircraft tires are built to much higher standards than truck tires, and their manufacture is highly labor-intensive. Higher production costs mean that a single tire can sell for EUR1,500.   Aviation tires suffer extreme stresses compared with their ground-bound equivalents. Military jet tires, for example, are designed to carry loads equivalent to two heavy trucks, and are inflated up to 20 atmospheres, as opposed to around two for car tires. At the same time, they have to be able to resist going from a static state to several hundred kilometers an hour, instantly, on landing. And they have to be capable of going from minus 45 degrees Celsius to boiling point at the end of a landing rollout without losing any of their attributes.   Although selling tires for new aircraft is good business, tire makers make most of their money from supplying replacement or retreaded tires to aircraft that are already in service. A short- to medium-range Airbus A320 or a Boeing 737, for example, needs a tire change four times a year over its 30-year life span.   Goodyear claims to be the market leader in volume sales, but Michelin says it has a 60% share of the fast-growing radial tire segment that currently accounts for about 15% of the overall aviation tire market.   The market leaders now offer a service to customer airlines - especially those in the U.S. - in which they provide either new or retreaded tires to airlines on the basis of the number of landings their planes make. That way, customers don't have the bother of keeping track of managing all the tires on their aircraft and ordering replacements as they become used.   The supply-management system makes it easier for both the airline and the tire makers to predict the requirements for new and replacement tires.   The surge in demand is prompting tire makers to increase production capacity. Last month, Bridgestone started construction on a second production plant for radial aircraft tires in Tokyo, and Michelin is investing EUR30 million over five years to expand output at its main facility at Bourges, in central France.   Thomas Besson, who follows Michelin from London for Merrill Lynch, agreed that "capacity constraints are starting to emerge," and that this is bolstering the pricing power of tire makers so that the business is becoming increasingly profitable.   Corbin said, however, that there's no supply shortage as yet. "No planes are being grounded because they don't have tires," he said.   Because of the labor-intensive nature of the business, Sanford Bernstein's Cheetham said, adding physical production capacity also implies adding and training more personnel. "Michelin may not be exactly dragging its feet, but it's a clever company, and it knows that the aviation industry is cyclical, so any new investment will be cautious," he said.   Until the 1980s, aircraft tires were made using a "bias" or crossply technique, but the gradual introduction of radial technology over the last two decades has given aircraft owners tires that are 20% to 30% lighter, and offer up to 50% more tread life.   Other advantages include less carcass fatigue, greater resistance to cuts and the ability to operate at cooler temperatures so that aircraft don't have to wait so long after landing to let their tires cool down before the planes take off again. All of these advantages contribute to lower maintenance costs.   Commenting on the surge in aircraft orders announced at the Paris Air Show, Goodyear's Varndell said that rather than rubbing their hands, he and his colleagues "were mopping our brows" in anticipation of a heavy workload.     -By David Pearson, Dow Jones Newswires; +331 4017 1740; david.pearson@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:30 ET (09:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Story: 0758 GMT [Dow Jones]--Merrill Lynch raises its target price for Autogrill (AGL.MI) to EUR17.5 from EUR15.5 and keeps a buy rating on the shares following the launch of its cash offer for the remaining stake it doesn't already own in Alpha Airports Group (AAP.LN). Headline: Credit Agricole Interested In Intesa Sanpaolo Branches -3-
Story: Credit Agricole will face steep competition as "over 10 financial institutions have submitted non-binding bids for the 198 branches," a person familiar with the situation said Wednesday.   Siena-based Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA (BMPS.MI), a consortium of Italian banks that includes Veneto Banca, Banca Carige SpA (CGE.MI), Credito Valtellinese SCARL (CVAL.MI) and Italian mutual bank Banca Popolare di Milano SCARL (PMI.MI), have submitted non-binding offers, people familiar with the situation said.   According to unsourced press reports, Citigroup Inc. (C) has also shown interest in the Intesa branches. A spokesman for Citigroup said "the bank doesn't comment on market rumors."   Contrary to press reports, Deutsche Bank is not among the bidders, a person familiar with the situation told Dow Jones Newswires. "Deutsche Bank has no ambitions regarding this," the person said.   Intesa Sanpaolo weren't immediately reachable for a comment.   At 1437 GMT, Intesa Sanpaolo shares in Milan were down EUR0.02, or 0.3%, at EUR5.54, in an overall flat market. Credit Agricole shares in Paris were trading 0.1% higher in a slightly upbeat market.   Company Web site: http://www.credit-agricole.fr   -By Nicolas Parasie, Dow Jones Newswires; nicolas.parasie@dowjones.com; +33 1 40 17 1770   (Sabrina Cohen and Ragnhild Kjetland in Milan and Alessandro Mocenni with MF-Dow Jones contributed to the report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:00 ET (15:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Citigroup Hires Ex-HSBC Banker Wallace To Head Asian M&A
Story: HONG KONG (Dow Jones)--Citigroup Inc. (C) said Wednesday it hired Steven Wallace, the former head of Asia-Pacific investment banking at HSBC Holdings PLC (HBC), to head its merger-and-acquisition operations in the Asia Pacific region.   In his new role as a managing director and head of M&A for Citigroup, Wallace will report to Mark Renton, head of investment banking for Asia Pacific, Citigroup said in a statement.   During his tenure at HSBC, Wallace oversaw "some of the region's most innovative and complex transactions," including the listing of Hong Kong's first real estate investment trust, the statement said.   The Link Real Estate Investment Trust, which listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange on Nov. 25, 2005, holds 180 shopping malls and car parks formerly owned by Hong Kong's Housing Authority.   Wallace resigned from HSBC over the weekend for personal reasons, a Hong Kong-based spokeswoman for HSBC said Tuesday. Tou Chen Chang, the bank's head of investment banking in Southeast Asia based in Singapore, will take over Wallace's post.     -By Amy Or, Dow Jones Newswires; 852-2832 2335; amy.or@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 00:11 ET (04:11 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : TriNorth Acquires Grapevine Surveys>TRT.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - July 4, 2007) - TriNorth Capital Inc. (TSX:TRT) has completed a reorganization of its holdings in Vitalink Worldwide Limited ("Vitalink") and Teragrid Solutions Inc. ("Teragrid").    Under the terms of the reorganization, which was effective June 30, 2007, TriNorth exchanged its 37% share interests in Vitalink and Teragrid for 100% ownership of Grapevine Surveys, a former division of Business.ca that offers on-line survey solutions to businesses, and a promissory note from Teragrid for $210,000 payable in 10 monthly installments commencing August 1, 2007. Teragrid has also agreed to provide Grapevine Surveys with hosting and software services until December 31, 2007 at no cost.    Grapevine Surveys provides survey solutions to businesses for employee evaluations, assessments and appraisals, 360 degree surveys, customer surveys such as customer satisfaction and customer service, web polls, on-line voting and data collection.    TriNorth Capital Inc. is a Canadian-based investment company that has privately held and publicly traded venture investments, investments in marketable securities and substantial tax losses to shelter future income and investment gains.    For more details about TriNorth and its investments please visit the Company's website at www.trinorthcapital.com.    This release contains forward-looking statements. Although the Company believes that the expectations reflected in such forward-looking statements are reasonable, it can give no assurance that such expectations will prove to have been correct, and such forward looking statements should not be unduly relied upon. These statements speak only as of the date of this release, and are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties, including the factors discussed in the Company's current and previous filings with the Canadian securities regulatory authorities. Actual results could differ materially from these forward-looking statements.                   FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             TriNorth Capital Inc. Headline: THE SKEPTIC: False Dawn At Oce
Story: (This story was originally published Tuesday)     By Mathijs Schiffers   A DOW JONES NEWSWIRES COLUMN     AMSTERDAM (Dow Jones)--Management at Oce is no doubt congratulating itself after the company's stock price jumped on the announcement of second-quarter earnings that beat analysts' expectations.   But that might be foolish.   The shrewd investor might be buying into Oce less because current management is doing a good job, but more because of the company's inability to turn around its main division. That suggests it might soon be the target of an activist investor seeking a big shakeup of the printer maker.   Oce beat expectations thanks to growth at its smallest unit that supplies wide-format printing systems, or WFPS, where the Dutch company has a competitive technological edge in a niche market.   But Oce's main unit - digital document systems which accounted for around 70% of its second-quarter sales - barely broke even.   Indeed, management has little to show for its acquisition of U.S.-based Imagistics, completed in November 2005 for $638 million, that was aimed at helping turn around the business. First-half sales at the DDS division fell around 3%, while it has managed only to edge into the black in the second quarter from a small loss a year earlier.   Oce's increased exposure to a weakened dollar hasn't helped, but the business is clearly battling to compete on the ground with the likes of the bigger Canon, Ricoh, and Xerox.   It's hard to see where Oce is going to find new operational leverage if it's had to pass on most of the merger benefits in the U.S. to customers.   Indeed, with little overlap between its two divisions.   The DDS division sells machines for high-volume printing, as in newspaper production, whereas the WFPS unit supplies more technical printing equipment used by the likes of advertisers and architects.   So the sooner management undertakes a more thorough strategic overview of Oce, the better - if it doesn't want to end up doing it under the pressure from more opportunist investors who might comes up with a plan of their own.     (Mathijs Schiffers has been a financial reporter since 1998, joining the Dow Jones Newswires Amsterdam bureau in 2004. He can be reached at +31-20-5890270 or by email at mathijs.schiffers@dowjones.com)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:45 ET (05:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Australia's Woodside Says No Major Disruption To Cossack Oil
Story: MELBOURNE (Dow Jones)--Woodside Petroleum Ltd. (WPL.AU) said Wednesday there has been no major disruption to oil production at the Cossack Pioneer joint venture, despite a media report saying that project partner BHP Billiton Ltd. (BHP) has been forced to declare force majeure on an oil shipment from the field.   Reuters reported that BHP Billiton has declared force majeure on a 650,000 barrel cargo of oil due to production problems at the field.   A spokeswoman for BHP Billiton declined to comment on the report.   "We don't comment around customer relationships but we are discussing that situation with our customers," she said.   A spokeswoman for Woodside, the operator of the joint venture, said that, as far as the company was aware, there has been no major disruption to production at Cossack Pioneer, which is part of the North West Shelf joint venture.   In the first quarter of 2007, Cossack Pioneer produced an average of 76,615 barrels of oil a day, lower than its normal 100,000 barrels a day, due to the impact of cyclones.   The equal partners in the North West Shelf joint venture are Woodside, BHP, Royal Dutch Sell PLC, Chevron Corp., Japan Australia LNG and BP PLC.       -By Alex Wilson, Dow Jones Newswires; 61-3-9671-4313; alex.wilson@dowjones.com     -Edited by Graham Morgan     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 00:47 ET (04:47 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : DaimlerChrysler Canada Reports June 2007 Sales
Story: <<      -   Sales climb 24.1 per cent in June      -   11 consecutive months of sales increases      -   New incentive program for July brings back Employee Price Discount,          Gas Card      -   First six months sales up 7.5 percent; number two seller in Canada      >>      WINDSOR, ON, July 4 /CNW/ - Chrysler Canada sales jumped 24.1 per cent in June 2007 marking the company's 11th straight month of sales increases. The company has sold 123,237 vehicles this year versus 114,659 last year making it the number two seller of cars and trucks in Canada. Car sales of 5,607 were up 54.1 per cent and 16,422 truck sales were up 16.3 per cent in June to total 22,029, versus 17,755 units in June 2006. June sales continued this year's rise in retail sales with double-digit growth. Sales of for the first half of 2007 are up 7.5 per cent over the same period last year.    "Our outstanding June sales performance shows that Chrysler is clearly on a roll in Canada," said Reid Bigland, President and CEO - Chrysler Canada. "We are solidly in 2nd place in the Canadian market and are seeing consistently strong retail sales, especially of our new, highly fuel-efficient vehicles like Dodge Caliber, Jeep Patriot, Jeep Compass and Chrysler Sebring."    Summer Momentum    A new incentive program for July features the return of the Employee Price Discount, offering an employee price discount program on nearly all 2007 model year Chrysler, Jeep(R) and Dodge vehicles, and a gas discount card from Petro-Canada that will allow customers to save 20 cents per litre for one year's worth of average driving. Eligible vehicles include all 2006 models, all 2007 models (except Dodge Caliber, Jeep Compass, Jeep Patriot, Jeep Wrangler and Dodge Sprinter) and the 2008 Dodge Avenger. Total possible savings on eligible vehicles range from $1,735 on the 2008 Dodge Avenger to $9,000 on a 2007 Dodge Caravan.    Sales Highlights    Total Jeep brand vehicle sales of 4,359 reached a new monthly high based on strong performance of Compass, Patriot and the new four-door Wrangler. Jeep brand sales increased 119 per cent over the same month last year. Other trucks with strong sales performance include Grand Cherokee with sales up 34.4 per cent and Dodge Dakota, which doubled sales versus the same month last year. Chrysler Pacifica sales were up 78.3 per cent to 419 units. Cars with strong sales performance include Chrysler Sebring (632 units); Chrysler 300/C (1,043 units), and Dodge Charger (936 units) which is up 98.7 per cent over the same month last year.         /CONTACT: Additional information and news from Chrysler Group is available at http://cgmedia.daimlerchrysler.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 14:32 ET (18:32 GMT)

Headline: Roche Asks Judge To Invalidate Ventana Poison Pill -Bloomberg
Story: ZURICH (Dow Jones)--Roche Holding AG (RHHBY) lodged a complaint against Ventana Medical Systems Inc. (VSMI), asking a judge to invalidate a defense measure by the U.S. company to fend off the Swiss drugmaker's unsolicited takeover, Bloomberg reported late Tuesday.   Roche wants to buy Ventana and would pay $75 a share, or around $3 billion in total.   In a Delaware Chancery Court lawsuit, Roche said the defense measure is unfair. The poison pill would give existing Ventana shareholders rights to buy new shares at half price if Roche acquires 20% or more of Ventana, making the buyout prohibitively expensive, Bloomberg said, citing court papers.   Roche wasn't immediately available to confirm the lawsuit, or to comment on it.   Company Web Site: http://www.roche.com   -Zurich Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +41 43 443 8040; zurichdjnews@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:59 ET (06:59 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: ITV: ITV1 Share Of Commercial Viewing Dn 5.6% At 32.3% -2-
Story: The U.K. television advertising market in the first half year was 0.3% down compared to the first half of 2006, whilst July is 10% up on 2006.   Sectors that are performing well include pharmaceuticals up 11% and telecoms up 7%, whilst retail, the largest category, was down 4%, ahead of the ITV family average, the company said.   Several categories were affected by the phasing of revenue in the first half of 2006, which included most of the World Cup spend.  Finance was down 10% and cars and car dealers were down 12%.  Sponsorship and non-spot advertising revenues are up year-on-year.   ITV1 has successfully regained audience share in the afternoon during the first half of the year, ITV said.   The company is now working on plans to improve the key 2000 GMT slot.  In the first half ITV screened 'Britain's Got Talent' which delivered an average audience of 11.6 million for the final, it said.    TV has acquired TV rights for the Euro 2008 football competition in conjunction with the BBC. Overall ITV1's adult viewing share in the first half was down by 4.7% on 2006 whilst in multichannel homes alone it was only down by 2.5%.   Within multichannel homes its digital channels continued to increase viewing share and overall ITV viewing share in those homes was down by 1%, the company said.   Overall ITV family adult and ABC1 impact volumes have been up in three out of six months so far this year.  Its digital channels continue to grow, with the aggregate all time viewing share up 6% at 4.5%.   ITV2, ITV3 and ITV4 all rank in the top 10 digital channels in Freeview with ITV2 and ITV3 taking the first and second positions respectively, it said.   ITVs overall programme investment in the first half, including ITV1,GMTV, its digital channels and regional programming, was GBP500 million (with minority share of ITV1 Network Programme Budget an additional GBP27 million).   As part of the revitalisation of ITV1, a number of new programmes are being commissioned while a number of longer-running programmes are being discontinued, ITV said.   The review of the provision of interactive services is continuing, the company said.   It has in place detailed policies and protocols to ensure the fair delivery of these services going forward and are conducting a review of recent programmes.  It expects to complete this over the summer and will publish the findings, the company said.   The relaunch of itv.com (www.itv.com) as a streaming video service is progressing well.   Full functionality, including live simulcasts of ITV channels, catch-up and archive, has been available since the launch of the 'Soaps' section on June 12, with the service being rolled-out thematically over the course of the summer, ITV said.   ITV Local's roll-out (www.itvlocal.tv) continues with coverage now extended to the Meridian, Central, London, Granada and Wales regions with a programme for the rest of the ITV plc regions by October.   ITV Play revenues have reduced very significantly since the media coverage of PRTS issues and in the first half revenue will be GBP9 million which is down by 67% on last year.   Friends Reunited revenue in the first half is up by over 25% on last year, the company said.   Dawn Airey's arrival in October will provide the company with the strong leadership to develop and grow the company's U.K. and international production and distribution operations building on the recent work of management in those businesses.    * ITV Adult impact volume                 ITV1 down 2.1%                 ITV family up 0.5%    * ITV total adult all time viewing share                 down 2% in all homes                 down 1% in multichannel homes    * H1 ITV plc NAR down 5%                ITV1 down 9% at GBP595 million                Digital channels andGMTV up 24% at GBP122 million     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 04:54 ET (08:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: HK Chinese Estates Up Sharply On Possible Sale
Story: (Adds closing stock price, analysts' comments.)       By Jonathan Li and Jeffrey Ng     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     HONG KONG (Dow Jones)--Chinese Estates Holdings Ltd. (0127.HK) soared Wednesday after the Hong Kong property developer confirmed it is in talks with several third parties on a possible sale.   Chinese Estates jumped 19% to close at HK$14.60, after hitting a record intraday high of HK$16. The stock opened at HK$15.50. Wednesday's surge raised the company's market capitalization to HK$33 billion from HK$27.8 billion, based on Friday's closing price of HK$12.30. Hong Kong's stock market was closed Monday for a public holiday.   The company's shares were suspended from trading Tuesday, following a report by the South China Morning Post that cited unnamed sources as saying a consortium of hedge funds and private-equity firms plans to buy the mid-tier developer.   Chinese Estates didn't identify the parties involved in the talks.   "These talks are at a preliminary and confidential stage and may or may not lead to an offer for the company," it said in a statement Wednesday.   In mid-May, Chairman Joseph Lau said he abandoned a plan to take the company private because of opposition from other major shareholders. Lau holds a controlling 47.29% stake in the company.   Analysts said Chinese Estates shares were trading at a deep discount to their net asset value of between HK$18.0 and HK$18.50 a share prior to Tuesday's trading halt, making the company an attractive acquisition target. Hong Kong-listed mid-tier property developers are currently trading at up to a 30% discount to their estimated net asset values.   The SCMP said Tuesday that The Children's Investment Fund, Och Ziff Management, Marathon and Fortress Investment Group were looking at ways to make a joint bid for Chinese Estates.   The consortium could also include buyout firm Texas Pacific Group, the newspaper said.   The Children's Investment Fund, a U.K.-based hedge fund, declined to comment Wednesday on the report. It owns 7.86% of Chinese Estates, according to the developer's latest filing to the Hong Kong stock exchange.   "I think hedge funds or private equity groups probably have their eyes on Chinese Estates' quality commercial property portfolio in Hong Kong, the value of which isn't reflected in the company's share price," said Y.K. Chan, a Hong Kong-based fund manager at Phillip Capital Management (HK) Ltd.   Analysts said the consortium could also generate higher investment returns by selling some of the developer's prized commercial properties in Hong Kong.   "This could be done via a property trust spin-off. With the proceeds (from the property sales), Chinese Estates could distribute a special dividend to its new shareholders," said a Hong Kong-based analyst, who declined to be named.   Chinese Estates' Hong Kong properties, which include investment properties and properties under development, accounted for 63.4% of the developer's estimated net asset value of HK$18.15 a share, brokerage house CLSA Group said in a report in late March.   The company's commercial properties in Hong Kong include shopping centers and office buildings in the bustling Causeway Bay and Tsim Sha Tsui areas.     -By Jonathan Li and Jeffrey Ng, Dow Jones Newswires; 852-2802-7002; jonathan.li@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:22 ET (09:22 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Cossette Communication Aims To Integrate U.K. Acquisitions
Story: By Mirella Christou     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--Now that Cossette Communications Group Inc. (KOS.T) is celebrating its "massive coup" in acquiring Dare Digital Ltd., a "needed key player" in London's digital marketing field, the company will focus on convergence of services and clients at a quick pace.   "The challenge and priority is to integrate, under the Cossette brand-name umbrella," the four U.K. firms acquired by Cossette in the past three years, Cossette's chief executive, Claude Lessard, said on a conference call.   Lessard said he expects the integration, which began 12 months ago with the three other businesses, will now accelerate with Dare, to put forward the Cossette brand, and serve clients together.   The other three London companies are brand consultancy firm Identica, public relations firm Band & Brown and advertising agency MCBD.   Cossette, Quebec City, offers a range of communications services to clients in North America and Europe.   Dare offers Web-site development, online advertising, e-mail marketing, digital outdoor and mobile marketing to such clients as Vodafone Group PLC, Barclays PLC, Sony Europe, ITV and Sony Ericsson, the last of which is also a client of Cossette. Dare has total gross income of about C$20 million in fiscal 2007.   The deal, which will be completed in three stages over six years, was characterized by Lessard as a "massive coup" for Cossette. This is because he views digital marketing as a strong investment for the company's future. Dare has a good "cultural fit" and will help to build upon Cossette's goal of "convergent communication."   Cossette has initially acquired 65.4% of Dare for about C$21 million. It can acquire the remaining 34.6% from 12 Dare employees under certain circumstances over the next five years.   When asked why the deal is structured in that way, Cossette's chief financial officer, Jean Royer, said on the call that Cossette wants Dare's owners to remain "incentivized."   Dare's employees are highly entrepreneurial and want to keep a stake in the company, Royer said. But after the six-year-deal is completed, the shareholders could leave the firm, Royer said. "It's a risk inherent in the business," he said.   Royer said the cost of buying 100% of Dare could be about C$42 million.   Royer said Cossette and Dare have similar margins and that pro forma share-earnings accretion is 3-4 Canadian cents, excluding amortization of intangible assets.   Aside from its consolidation in the U.K., Lessard said the priority for Cossette will be in the U.S. in the next 12 months, as the spectrum of offerings there is more limited than in either Canada or Europe.   In Toronto Wednesday, Cossette is unchanged at C$13 in thin trading.   Company Web Site: http://www.cossette.com     -Mirella Christou, Dow Jones Newswires: 416-306-2025 mirella.christou@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 14:36 ET (18:36 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: JAL To Speed Staffing Cuts, Pare Retirement Benefits - Nikkei
Story: TOKYO (Nikkei)--Japan Airlines Corp. (9205.TO) will trim its work force by 4,300 one year earlier than previously targeted and cut retirement benefits by 10%, according to a streamlining initiative released Wednesday, The Nikkei reported in its Thursday morning edition.   JAL President Haruka Nishimatsu announced the plan at a news conference.   A revitalization program already announced by the airline carrier called for the personnel reductions by the end of fiscal 2009.   "We have already accounted for a reduction of 3,500," Nishimatsu said. "We're considering ways to accomplish the goal a year earlier."   JAL began an early retirement program in April targeting senior managers. The scope will be broadened at the end of August to include junior managers in an effort to collectively thin their ranks by 700.   Nishimatsu also revealed that management would seek a 10% cut in retirement benefits during labor negotiations, which start Thursday.   On the airline operator's fundraising plans, Nishimatsu said, "The burden will not be so heavy with the use of aircraft leases and other steps.   "If Y140 billion can be raised from outside sources by fiscal 2010 - the last year of the medium-term business plan - we will reach our funding target," he added.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 14:59 ET (18:59 GMT)

Headline: : GGOF Launches New Series Of Principal Protected Deposit Notes Based On GGOF Dividend Growth Fund>
Story: TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - Guardian Group of Funds Ltd. (GGOF) today announced the launch of Bank of Montreal GGOF C.O.R.E. Protected Deposit Notes, Series 2, 3, and 4. The Deposit Notes are based on the performance of GGOF Dividend Growth Fund, which is managed by Michael Stanley of Jones Heward Investment Counsel Inc.    The Deposit Notes offer a number of compelling features for investors. A dynamic asset allocation strategy provides up to 200 per cent exposure to a portfolio of dividend-paying stocks in order to enhance returns. At the same time, the Deposit Notes provide investors with the comfort of knowing that 100  per cent of their principal is protected if held to maturity by Bank of Montreal as issuer. With a maximum all-inclusive annual fee of 2.60 per cent, the Deposit Notes are competitively priced and are available in three Classes for greater choice in meeting individual investor needs:    Total Return Class is most suitable for investors seeking long-term    capital growth. All the Fund portfolio distributions will be notionally    reinvested.    Yield Class is ideal for investors seeking regular monthly income. The    distribution rate will be 100 per cent of the distribution rate of the    Fund and will be interest income.    The R.O.C. Class is most suitable for investors seeking regular monthly    distributions and tax deferral. The distribution rate will be    100 per cent of the distribution rate of the Fund and will be R.O.C.    (Return of Capital), which is tax deferred until maturity or when note is    sold.    Each series has a 6-year term.    "GGOF Dividend Growth Fund is an excellent core holding for investors seeking long-term capital growth. Jones Heward manages the Fund, which has a strong long-term track record investing in a portfolio of dividend-paying stocks. The addition of a dynamic asset allocation strategy and the availability of principal protection at maturity make it that much more appealing," said Gavin Graham, GGOF's Chief Investment Officer. "With their very competitive pricing and availability in three different Classes, the Deposit Notes have been structured to be of interest to as wide an investor audience as possible."    GGOF Dividend Growth Fund    GGOF Dividend Growth Fund provides investors with the opportunity to benefit from dividend-paying stocks that have historically outperformed non-dividend-paying stocks over the long term. Dividend-paying stocks have historically provided the growth needed to generate long-term returns that outpace inflation and taxes. The Fund's goal is to generate a high level of tax-effective returns which includes dividend income and some capital gains from the increase in the value of securities held in the Fund's portfolio.    Guardian Group of Funds    GGOF provides investors with a full product line of 34 mutual funds, diversified by asset class, geographic region and capitalization. GGOF, with $6.2 billion of mutual fund assets under management at April 30, 2007, offers its funds exclusively through financial intermediaries.    GGOF is a member of the BMO Financial Group and part of the organization's Private Client Group. The Private Client Group provides integrated wealth management services in Canada and the United States and had total assets under management and administration and term investments of $299.86 billion as at April 30, 2007.             /CONTACT: Gavin Graham, GGOF, (416) 350-3151; JoAnne Hayes, BMO Financial Group, (416) 867-3996; Internet: www.ggof.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:01 ET (14:01 GMT)

Headline: MARKET TALK: JP Morgan Sees More Insurance Shr Buybacks
Story: 0716 GMT [Dow Jones]--JP Morgan's Michael Hutter says he has increased confidence in share buybacks from insurers after S&P gives capital relief in a new model. Insurers will use the extra capital flexibility to continue buybacks, which offers extra support to buyback forecasts for Munich Re (MUV2.XE), Swiss Re (RUKN.VX), Zurich Financial (ZURN.VX), Allianz (AZ) and soon Generali (G.MI), Huttner says. Munich Re has done EUR541M of a EUR2B program running until April '08, while Huttner sees Zurich doing CHF1.2B in '08, and Allianz announcing a EUR2B buyback in '08 and '09 each. Generali is seen reviving a buyback program with a three-year plan in September. Headline: Toronto Stks Close Flat On Very Quiet Trading Day -2-
Story: Seven of Toronto's 10 sector indexes traded higher, with the telecom group the only group to end up more than 1.00%.   The telecom group gained 1.19%, with Telus rising C$1.05 to C$65.65 on speculation it could be the next big Canadian telecom firm to be acquired. BCE, which ended up 0.07 to 41.32, has agreed to be acquired by an investment group led by Ontario Teachers Pension Fund for C$42.75. There is some speculation that Telus could step in with a rival bid for BCE, as the firm, which pulled out of the auction, indicated it hasn't closed the door to making a bid.   The materials group gained 0.55%, with Teck Cominco rising 0.79 to 46.59 and Aur Resources rising 0.34 to 41.90. Aur rose sharply Tuesday on news that it agreed to be acquired in a friendly deal by Teck in a deal valued at C$4.1 billion.   Among other positive finishers, the consumer discretionary group gained 0.14%, the utilities group added 0.98% and the health care group rose 0.24%.   On the down side, the energy group fell 0.50%, the industrials group dipped 0.02% and the financial services group slid 0.38%.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 16:23 ET (20:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : DICOM Group plc: Trading and Business Strategy Update
Story: BASINGSTOKE, England--(BUSINESS WIRE)--July 04, 2007--   DICOM Group plc ("DICOM Group") (LSE:DCM), a global leader of Intelligent Capture & Exchange solutions, announces that trading in the fourth quarter of the financial year ended 30 June 2007 was broadly in line with expectations and that the Group continues to be strongly cash generative.     As a result of an in-depth review, the Board commenced plans to reorganise and reallocate resources from some of the Group's traditional businesses to more attractive growth areas. Specifically, the Group will focus increasingly on scalable and repeatable transactional capture solutions which are addressed by DICOM Group's new Intelligent Capture & Exchange suite of products and solutions.     As a consequence of these plans, the Group is incurring an exceptional charge of approximately GBP 3.0 million, to be recorded in the financial year ending 30 June 2007. At the same time, the Board intends to invest in initiatives that will drive sales of transactional capture solutions referred to above, and is targeting double digit revenue growth in its software business during the year ahead.       Rob Klatell, Chief Executive Officer, stated:     "I am pleased to announce that fourth quarter trading has been broadly in line with expectations. At the same time, the traditional batch capture market remains under pressure from the continuing trends of consolidation and commoditisation, thereby rendering it a segment with diminishing long-term opportunity. Our further shift towards transactional solutions positions DICOM Group well for future growth. We are confident that these changes will position us to grow our business over the next few years into one of the most successful providers of integrated content capture, transformation and exchange solutions globally."     Further details of these initiatives will be given at the full year results in late August 2007.        CONTACT: DICOM Group plc               Gabriele Rosenbusch, +44 (0) 800 6520 616               Head of Investor Relations               gabriele_rosenbusch@dicomgroup.com               http://www.dicomgroup.com        SOURCE: DICOM Group plc  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 03:07 ET (07:07 GMT)

Headline: MARKET TALK: Credit Suisse Upgrades Euro Telecoms Sector
Story: 0653 GMT [Dow Jones] Credit Suisse raises its rating on the European telecommunications sector to overweight from neutral after raising five year revenue growth forecasts. The move reflects higher forecasts for mobile growth, and growing demand for data services. Says the upgrade implies a better earnings outlook for the incumbents in particular, but notes some of this has already been priced in. On technical terms, Credit Suisse says the sector looks less overbought than at the start of the year and is still under-owned against long-term average holding levels. Also notes the sector is trading at a PE below historical levels while posting the highest dividend yield across all European sectors. Headline: UPDATE: Credit Agricole Bids For Intesa Sanpaolo Branches
Story: (This updates an item that ran at 1400 GMT with analyst comment and background.)       By Nicolas Parasie     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     PARIS (Dow Jones)--French bank Credit Agricole (4507.FR) Wednesday said it submitted a bid for some or all of 198 branches put up for sale by Intesa Sanpaolo SpA (ISP.MI).   "I can confirm we're interested in the file," spokesman Alain Berry said.   "But I can't say in which manner we are," he added, leaving open the option that the bank may offer for only some of the 198 branches put up for sale.   A successful bid would strengthen the French bank's network of around 650 branches in Italy that it already owns.   "This is a good opportunity for Credit Agricole to enlarge their existing footprint in Italy, depending on where these branches are located, of course," a Paris-based banking analyst said.   The potential move also underpins Credit Agricole's growing need to expand in faster-growing markets, as the French retail market is slowing and subject to fierce competition. The French bank recently unveiled ambitious plans for its Greek subsidiary and is among the bidders for an Algerian state-owned bank that is expected to be privatized later this year.   "I expect the sale price of Intesa Sanpaolo branches in the EUR1.5 billion range," said Elena Perini, a banking analyst with RASBank in Milan. She added that the French bank "has already shown it aims at expanding at a fast pace in Italy."   In December, Italy's antitrust authority approved the merger between Banca Intesa SpA and Sanpaolo Imi SpA, but on the condition that the newly merged company would sell a total of 748 branches.   Intesa shareholder Credit Agricole last year had bought nearly 650 branches in total - 193 outlets and two regional banks - from the Italian bank for EUR6 billion, in return for waiving its veto of Intesa's merger with Sanpaolo.   Credit Agricole will face steep competition as "more than 10 financial institutions have submitted non-binding bids for the 198 branches," a person familiar with the situation said Wednesday.   Siena-based Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA (BMPS.MI), a consortium of Italian banks that also includes Veneto Banca, Banca Carige SpA (CGE.MI), Credito Valtellinese SCARL (CVAL.MI) and Italian mutual bank Banca Popolare di Milano SCARL (PMI.MI), have submitted non-binding offers, people familiar with the situation said.   According to unsourced press reports, Citigroup (C) and Deutsche Bank AG (DB) have also shown interest in the Intesa branches.   But Deutsche Bank isn't among the bidders, a person familiar told Dow Jones Newswires. "Deutsche Bank has no ambitions regarding this," the person said.   A spokesman of Citigroup said "the bank doesn't comment on market rumors," while Intesa Sanpaolo wasn't immediately reachable for a comment.   Credit Agricole shares since the branch acquisitions in Italy have outperformed the French CAC 40 index, but in recent months suffered from a share price decline, after weaker-than-expected first-quarter results. At 1540 GMT, the shares were up EUR0.04, or 0.1%, to EUR30.   Company Web site: http://www.credit-agricole.fr   -By Nicolas Parasie, Dow Jones Newswires; nicolas.parasie@dowjones.com; +33 1 40 17 1770   (Christian Streckert in Frankfurt, Sabrina Cohen and Ragnhild Kjetland in Milan and Alessandro Mocenni with MF-Dow Jones contributed to this report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:46 ET (15:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Embraer Begins Construction Of $8M Service Ctr In Arizona>ERJ
Story: MESA, Ariz. (AP)--Construction has begun on a new $8 million service center to maintain jets made by Brazilian jet maker Empresa Brasileira de Aeronautica (ERJ), or Embraer, at Mesa's Williams Gateway Airport, a facility that officials hope will bring national recognition to the site.   The 45,000-square-foot center will be Embraer's only factory-run repair shop in the western U.S.   Williams Gateway Authority, the airport's multi-city governing body, will spend more than $12 million on infrastructure to support the Embraer facility and lure other tenants to the former Air Force base.   The facility will fix versions of Embraer's eight-passenger Legacy 600 executive jets and a new super-premium line, Phenom, which the company introduced in June, Davis said. The shop will be able to handle three to eight jets at a time.   Embraer is building similar service centers in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., and Hartford, Conn.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:39 ET (05:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Moody's Rates UBS (CH) Instl Fund-Bonds A/Mr3
Story: The following is a press release from Moody's Investors Service:     New York, July 04, 2007 -- Moody's Investors Service has today assigned a bond fund credit rating of A and a market risk rating of MR3 to the UBS (CH) Institutional Fund - Bonds CHF Inland Passive, which attempts to replicate the Swiss Domestic Bond Index and is managed by UBS Global Asset Management. The Fund's A credit rating reflects the upper medium-grade credit quality of the bond portfolio's investments, the manager's investment strategy and the Fund's diversification and issuer guidelines. The rating also reflects the fund advisor's strong investment, research and risk management capabilities. The MR3 market risk rating reflects the Fund's moderate sensitivity to interest rate changes, primarily due to it's effective duration which was 6.0 years as of 20 June 2007.   The UBS (CH) Institutional Fund - Bonds CHF Inland Passive is a sub-fund of the UBS (CH) Institutional Fund, domiciled in Switzerland. The Fund's objective is to replicate a benchmark of bonds denominated in Swiss francs (CHF), as represented by the Swiss Bond Domestic Index (SBDI), and to achieve performance in line with that of this benchmark. In doing so, the manager employs a stratified sampling technique to replicate the benchmark index's composition and return, however, the Fund's investment guidelines afford the manager some very limited discretion with regards to the management of both the duration as well as the asset composition of the Fund. The maximum permissible ex-ante tracking error by the Fund's internal guidelines is 0.5% and historically the investment adviser has managed the Fund at 0.2% tracking error, over the period from the Fund's inception to April 30, 2007.   The A credit rating reflects the Fund's overall high credit quality and also the fact that a small percentage of the Canton and Cantonal Bank issued securities, 1.2% as of May 18, 2007, does not carry a rating from any major credit rating agency. As of May 18, 2007, 87% of the Fund's assets were invested in sovereign and cantonal issued securities and 13% were invested in corporate financial issuers and Pfandbriefs, a composition consistent with that of the benchmark index to within 1%. As of the same date, about 80% of the Fund's holdings carried Aaa Moody's ratings.   The MR3 market risk rating primarily reflects the Fund's moderate sensitivity to interest rate changes. While the duration of the portfolio is not actively managed, internal investment guidelines permit the manager to deviate from the duration of its benchmark index by 10%. The Index's average historical duration since its inception in October 1998, has been 5.7 years, with a maximum of 6.2 years and a minimum of 5.1 years. The Fund manager does not currently make use of derivatives to manage the Fund's duration. While the investment adviser has no immediate plans to engage in derivatives-based investing, the Fund's prospectus permits the use of over-the-counter and exchange-traded interest rate derivatives.   UBS Global Asset Management (UBS Global AM) is a wholly owned subsidiary of UBS AG (Moody's senior unsecured rating Aaa). UBSGAM provides investment products and services to private clients, financial intermediaries and institutional investors around the world through its major offices in Zurich, London, Frankfurt, Tokyo and Chicago. It is currently the largest fund manager in Switzerland and its services include institutional asset management, pooled funds, investment funds and mutual funds, traditional and alternative investments, hedge and investment fund administration services. As of March 31st 2007, UBS Global AM had assets under management of CHF 883 billion ( 544 billion).   Moody's money market and bond fund ratings express opinions on the investment quality of shares in mutual funds and similar investment vehicles that principally invest in short-term and long-term fixed-income obligations, respectively. Moody's fund ratings address both credit quality and market risk considerations. The credit ratings reflect the average credit quality of a portfolio and are not intended to consider the prospective performance of a fund with respect to appreciation, volatility of net asset value, or yield. Funds rated A are judged to be of an investment quality similar to A-rated fixed-income obligations -- that is, they are judged to be of the upper medium quality by all standards. In addition to a credit quality rating, Moody's also assigns a market risk rating using a six-tiered numerical scale, from MR1+ to MR5. Funds with the least sensitivity to market changes will receive an MR1 rating, whilst the most sensitive funds will be rated MR5. Funds rated MR3 reflect the Fund's moderate sensitivity to changes in interest rate and other market conditions.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:40 ET (06:40 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : OPMEDIC GROUP Inc. Announces Solid Financial Results For The Third Quarter Ended May 31, 2007>OMG.T
Story: MONTREAL, July 4 /CNW Telbec/ - OPMEDIC GROUP Inc. ("OPMEDIC GROUP") (TSX: "OMG"), a healthcare-related services company providing facilities and services to patients and surgeons, is pleased to announce its financial results for the third quarter ended May 31, 2007.    HIGHLIGHTS :          <<      - Revenue up 29%. Revenue for the quarter totalled $2.556 million        compared to $1.980 million for the same period a year earlier.      - Net earnings up 44%. Net earnings for the third quarter were        $0.290 million ($0.02 per share), compared to $0.202 million        ($0.01 per share) in 2006.      >>      Revenue    Revenue for the quarter ended May 31, 2007 totalled $2.556 million, up $0.576 million or 29% from $1.980 million for the same period a year earlier. The new prenatal screening tests offered by the Company contributed $0.367 million over the quarter. In the corresponding quarter of the previous year, the Company received $0.078 million in fees for these same tests. This upward trend will continue throughout the fiscal year. In addition, the new OPMEDIC division generated new surgical revenue of $0.311 million.    For the first nine months of the fiscal year, revenue totalled $6.921 million, for an increase of $1.373 million or 25% from $5.548 million in 2006. The prenatal screening tests provided by the Company since October 2006 contributed $0.897 million. Fees for these same tests were $0.192 million the previous year. The OPMEDIC division generated new surgical revenue of $0.610 million.    Cost of Services    The cost of services for the quarter ended May 31, 2007 rose from $0.815 million in 2006 to $1.113 million in 2007, an increase of $0.298 million. Expenses of $0.227 million incurred by the OPMEDIC surgical division accounted for most of this increase. Moreover, the new prenatal screening services resulted in additional payroll expense and supplies of $0.080 million.    For the first nine months of the fiscal year, the cost of services was $3.148 million, up by $0.993 million from $2.155 million in 2006. The surgical division's new expenses of $0.753 million and prenatal screening costs of $0.246 million accounted for this increase.    Gross Profit    Gross profit for the quarter ended May 31, 2007 was $1.443 million, up 24% from $1.165 million in 2006. The new prenatal screening services offered contributed $0.209 million, and the OPMEDIC division, which posted a gross profit for the first time, had a positive impact of $0.084 million compared to the same quarter a year earlier.    For the first nine months of the fiscal year, gross profit was $3.773 million, up 11% from $3.393 million in 2006. The $0.459 million contribution of the new prenatal screening services was offset by the $0.143 million higher loss of the OPMEDIC division, which had opened its doors in May 2006.    The gross margin for the quarter ended May 31, 2007 was 56%, compared to 59% in 2006. For the first nine months of the year, gross margin rose to 55% in 2007, as against 61% in 2006. The start-up period for the OPMEDIC division, and more specifically the costs relating to the new Laval premises, pushed down the ratio in 2007.    General and Administrative Expenses    General and administrative expenses for the third quarter ended May 31, 2007 totalled $0.691 million, up $0.083 million from $0.608 million in 2006. New expenses related to the opening of the Laval operating rooms accounted for this difference because the new premises were inaugurated in May 2006.    For the nine-month period ended May 31, 2007, general and administrative expenses were $2.189 million, compared to $1.702 million for the corresponding period in 2006, for an increase of $0.487 million. New expenses incurred as a result of the opening of the Laval operating rooms totalled $0.465 million, with higher professional fees of $0.226 million in 2007, of which $0.111 million was attributable to the settlement with Warnex Inc. in October 2006. The higher fees were offset by the $0.143 million decrease in stock-based compensation.    Net Earnings (Loss)    Net earnings and basic and diluted net earnings per share for the third quarter were respectively $0.290 million and $0.02, compared to $0.202 million and $0.01, respectively, in 2006.    For the nine-month period, the net loss was $0.400 million and the basic and diluted net loss per share was $0.02, whereas in 2006, net earnings were $0.657 million, basic earnings per share were $0.05 and diluted earnings per share were $0.04. The non-recurring expense of $1.250 million settlement for the prenatal screening tests in 2007 accounted for most of this difference.    Detailed financial results can be accessed on the OPMEDIC GROUP web site at www.opmedicgroup.com.    About OPMEDIC GROUP    OPMEDIC GROUP is a company incorporated under the laws of the Province of Quebec which provides healthcare-related services including surgical facilities and services to patients and surgeons (with its OPMEDIC division), fertility treatments, medical imaging, laboratory services and diagnostic procedures (with its PROCREA Cliniques division) and sperm banking services (with its PROCREA Cryopreservation Centre subsidiary). OPMEDIC GROUP's Common Shares trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "OMG".    This news release does not constitute an offer to sell or to solicitation of an offer to buy any security and shall not constitute an offer, solicitation or sale in any jurisdiction in which such offerting would be unlawful. This news release contains certain forward-looking statements that reflect the current views and/or expectations of OPMEDIC GROUP with respect to its performance, business and future events. Such statements are subject to a number of risks, uncertainties and assumptions. Actual results and events may vary significantly.    The Content of this press release has not been approved by nor submitted    to the TSX which assumes no liability therefore.         /CONTACT: Jean-Marc LACHANCE, Vice President Finances and Chief Financial Officer, (514) 345-8535, x 2260,  jmlachance@opmedicgroup.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 16:01 ET (20:01 GMT)

Headline: MARKET TALK: Richter FDA Approval Mildly Positive - KBC
Story: 0753 GMT [Dow Jones] KBC Securities regards the FDA approval for Richter (RICHTER.BU) to produce anti-fungal generic products as mildly positive. Expects the production of this tablet to lift Richter's net profit by 3% to HUF38.91B in 2007 and by 2.5% to HUF 46.43B in 2008. Sees harsh generic competition eroding prices significantly from their original level and allowing Richter to obtain only a 5.6% market share in the relevant segment. KBC expects Richter to realize $23M in annual sales from the production of this drug and this could boost the company's bottom-line by $4.5M per annum. Keeps buy rating, HUF42,454 fair value. Shares trade +1.1% at HUF37,810.
