Headline: EUROPEAN MORNING BRIEFING: Stocks Flat Ahead Of Meetings
Story: DJIA       13577.30  +41.87  +0.31%  Nasdaq        2644.95  +12.65  +0.48%  S&P 500       1524.87   +5.44  +0.36%  FTSE 100      6639.80  +49.20  +0.75%  Xetra DAX     8050.68  +92.44  +1.16%  CAC40         6069.84  +42.89  +0.71%  Above are closing prices    Nikkei 225   18178.68  +28.78  +0.20%  Hang Seng    22114.88  +63.74  +0.30%  S&P/ASX 200   6330.50   -3.30  -0.11%  Taiwan Index  9070.97  +74.77  +0.80%  S.Korea Kospi 1834.22  +28.72  +1.60%  Dow Future    Closed  NASDAQ Future Closed  S&P Future    Closed  Above are as of 0450 GMT    USD/JPY      122.41-44    +0.02%  Range        122.51  - 122.23  EUR/USD      1.3615-18    +0.01%  Range        1.3617  - 1.3607  AUD/USD      0.8572-75   +0.34%  Range        0.8577  - 0.8545  GBP/USD      2.0174-79    +0.02%  Range        2.0184  - 2.0159  USD/CHF      1.2149-51    -0.06%  Range        1.2163  -  1.2149  Above are as of 0450 GMT vs NY close    USD/JPY Vol Option Contract 7.00%/7.30%  EUR/USD Vol Option Contract 5.05%/5.20%  AUD/USD Vol Option Contract 7.65%/7.90%  GBP/USD Vol Option Contract 5.10%/5.30%  USD/CHF Vol Option Contract 5.40%/5.70%  Above are 1-Mo prices as of 0400 GMT    2Y Tsy  99 31/32  -2/32  4.89% +3.3  5Y Tsy  99 23/32  -6/32  4.94% +4.1  10Y Tsy 95 27/32 -10/32  5.04% +4.3  10Y JGB 1.9100% +0.0300  Closing Treasury prices vs prior NY close; JGB as of 0400 GMT    Asian Spot Gold $653.15  +$0.15 +0.02%  Comex Gold      $656.10  +$0.70  +0.1%  Brent Crude Oil  $72.77  -$0.16  -0.2%  Above are as of 0400 GMT vs NY close     EUROPEAN OUTLOOK & US/ASIAN SUMMARIES:   European stock markets are likely to open little changed with the U.S. closed for a holiday. Government debt is under slight pressure, the euro and oil are on the defensive and gold is slightly higher.   STOCKS:   European shares are pegged to open largely flat, as investors sit tight ahead of the central bank meetings Thursday.   Spreadbettor Cantor Index is calling the FTSE up 1 point at 6641, the DAX down 6 at 8045, the CAC unchanged at 6070 and Eurostoxx off 2 at 4353.   U.S. stocks ended higher in a holiday-shortened session Tuesday, helped by news that Apple could see higher-than-expected profit margins from its iPhone and data showing a rise in factory orders. Wall Street is closed for a holiday Wednesday.   Michael Sheldon, chief market strategist at Spencer Clarke LLC, said investors shouldn't breathe a sigh of relief just yet. "In general, volatility levels have been rising over the last couple of weeks. You're likely to see a pickup in volatility in the third quarter," Sheldon said.   In deal news, Hilton Hotels agreed to be acquired by Blackstone for $18.5 billion in cash plus the assumption of $7.5 billion in debt.   Buyout firm KKR filed to raise $1.25 billion in an initial public offering, following in the footsteps of arch rival Blackstone Group.   In Asia, Japan's market edged up but held steady in a confined range.   The Australian market was largely flat, having failed to sustain an early rise on the back of gains on Wall Street and by BHP Billiton.   "I just think there's a lack of any catalysts at the moment," said David Halliday, associate director at Macquarie Private Wealth. "BHP and Rio are strong and there are plenty of reasons to buy them, but outside of that it becomes a bit difficult. So in the absence of any macro catalysts, the market is probably going to range trade."   FOREX:   The euro is on the defensive Wednesday against the dollar and yen after Moody's placed Japan's A2 government rating on review for upgrade, says a trader at a Tokyo securities company.   Against the dollar, the euro is expected to hold in a narrow range amid expectations for U.S. and euro zone interest rates to rise.   On Tuesday, the euro was little changed. The dollar on Tuesday showed "some stability after losing much ground (Monday) on global interest rate considerations," said Nick Bennenbroek, head of currency strategy at Wells Fargo Bank. "The markets are awaiting interest rate announcements from the Bank of England and European Central Bank...as well as the U.S. employment numbers."   BONDS:   European government bonds are expected to start under slight pressure, after they traded lower Tuesday because of stronger equity markets and weakness in euro/dollar exchange rates.   A general feeling of confidence in the U.S. economy are keeping bond prices from skyrocketing, analysts said.   "Only if this confidence is undermined again will the bulls gain the upper hand," analysts at Commerzbank said in a research note. "Until then, the bears may annoy them for some time yet."   Jason Simpson, an analyst at ABN AMRO, said he still sees room for a market bounce as fears about subprime markets weaken equity sales and terrorism fears promote safe haven flows. The recent selloff may have run too far, indicating a need for a move in the opposite direction, he said.   Finally, technical factors could point to a rebound, especially when the euro area has EUR14.5 billion in coupons and EUR28.9 billion in redemption payments due this week and only EUR11.5 billion in new issuance to soak up liquidity, Simpson said.   U.S. Treasury prices closed lower Tuesday, with stock gains and stronger-than-anticipated factory orders counteracting anemic housing data and concerns about potential terrorist activity. The bond market is closed Wednesday in observance of a U.S. holiday.   Broad gains chalked up by stocks overseas and on Wall Street contributed to decreased demand for government bonds. The market did draw some support from ongoing worries about subprime mortgage loans and possible terrorist activity. "Continued credit and event risk fears are ... keeping a bid in the Treasury market," wrote analysts at Action Economics.   In Japan, prices of government bonds fell on worries that the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates.   ENERGY:   Oil prices retreated Wednesday amid quiet trading and light profit taking after crude futures in New York rose to a new 10-month high Tuesday. August Nymex dropped 20 cents to $71.21 a barrel. The contract rose 32 cents to settle at $71.41 a barrel Tuesday.   METALS:   Spot gold was up 15 cents at $653.15/oz in Asia on expectations that the metal will rise to $700 later this year because of strong demand.   LME 3-month copper hit a 7-week high at $7,800/ton, up $80, as shorts moved to cover, said a Hong Kong-based LME broker.   CALENDAR:  Wednesday, July 4, 2007  GMT                                                         Expected Previous  0700  UK   Jun     House Price Index                        +0.4%MM   +0.3%MM                                                              +10.8%YY +10.6%YY  0745  ITA  Jun     Italy NTC / ADACI PMI Svcs               56.9      56.5  0750  FRA  Jun     France NTC / CDAF PMI Svcs               58.5      57.9  0755  GER  Jun     Germany NTC / BME PMI Svcs               58.0      57.5  0800  EU   Jun     RBS / NTC Euro-zone PMI Svcs              58.3      58.3  0830  UK   Q1      BoE Quarterly Mortgage Equity            GBP15.0B GBP14.6B  0830  UK   Jun     CIPS PMI Svcs                               57.2      57.2  0900  EU   May     Retail trade                             -0.3%MM   +0.2%MM                                                              +1.0%YY   +1.6%YY  0900  GER          Reopening of 10-Yr Bond Issue  0930  UK   Jun     Shop Price Index  N/A   UK   Jul     BoE Monetary Policy Committee meeting with                     interest rates decision Thursday  N/A   US           Fourth of July holiday; all markets                     closed   -By Dennis Baker; Dow Jones Newswires; dennis.baker@dowjones.com     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:00 ET (05:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: India Govt OKs $465 Mln Invest Plan By Morgan Stanley
Story: NEW DELHI (Dow Jones)--The Indian government Wednesday said it has approved 10 foreign direct investment proposals totaling INR23.39 billion ($577.82 million), including a plan by the Mauritius unit of Morgan Stanley (MS) to invest $465 million in its local subsidiary.   The Foreign Investment Promotion Board has approved Morgan Stanley Mauritius Co. Ltd.'s plans to invest in a mix of equity and compulsorily convertible preference shares to be issued by Morgan Stanley India Securities Ltd., the finance ministry said in a statement.   The FIPB, a part of the finance ministry, also approved a proposal by Japan's Furukawa Electric Co. Ltd. (5801.TO) to invest INR196.35 million in a joint venture in India to manufacture and sell automobile spare parts, the statement said.       -By Gaurav Raghuvanshi, Dow Jones Newswires; 91-11-2307-4020; gaurav.raghuvanshi@dowjones.com   -Edited by Alpana Sarma     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:55 ET (10:55 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Primaris Retail REIT Announces Earnings Conference Call, Delivers Acquisitions Update>PMZ.UN.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - July 4, 2007) - Primaris Retail REIT (TSX:PMZ.UN) will report its second quarter, fiscal year 2007 financial results on Friday, August 10, 2007 after market close. Senior Management will discuss the results in a live conference call with the financial community on Monday, August 13, 2006 at 9:00 a.m. EST.    The telephone numbers for the conference are: 416-641-6114 (within Toronto), and 1-866-226-1798 (within North America).    Audio replays of the conference call will be available immediately following the completion of the conference call, and will remain active until Friday, August 11, 2007. The replay will be accessible by dialing 416-695-5800 or 1-800-408-3053 and using the pass code 3227727#.    Acquisitions Update    The previously announced acquisitions of Place d'Orleans in Ottawa, Northland Village Shoppes in Calgary and Garden City Square in Winnipeg have all closed. The acquisition of Westbank Shopping Centre in Westbank, BC is expected to close in July, and the acquisition of Heritage Place in Owen Sound is expected to close in August. Year-to-date acquisitions, including Westbank Shopping Centre and Heritage Place, represent a $304 million investment.    Interest Rate Hedge    The REIT arranged an interim credit facility to fund the closing of Place d'Orleans and is currently seeking replacement long-term financing. In the meantime, the REIT entered into an interest rate hedge contract that effectively locks in the underlying Government of Canada ("GOC") rate at 4.43% for an anticipated ten-year term loan. The interest cost on this proposed loan will include an as yet unknown credit spread to be added to the underlying GOC rate.    The REIT expects to apply hedge accounting treatment to the hedge and would defer and amortize any gains or losses on the hedge over the expected ten-year term of the loan.    Primaris Retail REIT is a TSX listed real estate investment trust (TSX:PMZ.UN). Upon completion of the announced acquisitions, Primaris Retail REIT will own 26 properties comprising approximately 9.4 million square feet located in Canada. As of June 30, 2007 the REIT had 58,590,888 units issued and outstanding.                   FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             Primaris Retail REIT           R. Michael Latimer           Chief Executive Officer           (416) 865-5353           or           Primaris Retail REIT           Louis M. Forbes           Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer           (416) 865-5360     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 10:03 ET (14:03 GMT)

Headline: Alcatel-Lucent Wins Optical Network Deal With Korea's Hanaro
Story: Edited press release   PARIS--Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) has signed a contract with Hanaro Telecom (033630.KQ), a major broadband service provider in Korea, to support its network expansion. Alcatel-Lucent will supply its optical networking solution to increase Hanaro Telecom's network capacity. This will enable Hanaro Telecom to accommodate its significant subscriber growth and the increased bandwidth requirements driven by the "hanaTV" video-on-demand and "hanafos" high-speed data services. The project is scheduled for completion in the third quarter 2007.   "With the deployment of Alcatel-Lucent's advanced optical network, we address our growing broadband traffic demands with enhanced efficiency and cost-effectiveness," said Seung-Seog Lee, Chief Technology Officer at Hanaro Telecom "Upon completion, this project will allow us to deliver the most advanced services with the highest quality and reliability and to be prepared for deploying interactive IPTV service in the near future."   "This contract further sustains the traction of our optical networking solutions in the Asia-Pacific region, where we have experienced significant growth over the past quarters," said Frederic Rose, President of Alcatel-Lucent activities in Asia-Pacific. "This achievement also confirms our commitment to assist our customers in their move to next-generation optical networks."   No financial details were provided.   Company Website: www.alcatel-lucent.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 05:31 ET (09:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MARKET TALK: Deutsche Bank Downgrades Adecco To Hold
Story: 0646 GMT [Dow Jones] Deutsche Bank downgrades Adecco (ADEN.VX) to hold from buy. "We like Adecco but feel that the upside from the key triggers we outlined when upgrading the stock in February are now mostly priced in," says Deutsche's Tom Sykes. Although he sees 2Q as a strong earnings quarter, he is concerned that US growth may not live up to expectations in 2H and that growth in France may also slow. That may limit Adecco's upside, Sykes says. Target is CHF101. Shares indicated -0.5% at CHF95.20 pre-market. Headline: MARKET TALK: Pegas Nonwovens Lead Investor Considers Selling
Story: 0714 GMT [Dow Jones] Pegas Nonwovens SA (BAAPEGAS.PR), Europe's second-largest maker by volume of textiles for diapers, said Pamplona Capital Partners, who owns 43.3% of Pegas's shares, is considering selling its stake. Late last year Pamplona floated a majority of Pegas' shares when it took the company public, and its blackout on selling its remaining shares expired on June 18. Pamplona told Pegas that ING is advising Pamplona on the sale of the remaining shares. Pegas closed +0.4% at 824.5 Tuesday in a market broadly higher. Headline: : Spectral Launches U.S. Distribution Of Its Rapid West Nile Test >SDI.T
Story: TORONTO, July 4 /CNW/ - Spectral Diagnostics Inc. ("Spectral") today announced the conclusion of an agreement with Fisher Healthcare ("Fisher"), a division of Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc., for the distribution of its  RapidWN(TM) West Nile Virus Test ("RapidWN(TM)") in the United States. Product shipments are expected to begin this month. Distribution channels for the RapidWN(TM) are now in place in the United States and in Canada.    The Center for Disease Control (CDC) has already reported six human cases of West Nile infection in three states as of June 12, 2007, and many states have confirmed the presence of the virus in mosquitoes or avian carriers. The peak incidence of infection typically occurs in August or September of each year.    "We are very pleased to have reached an agreement with Fisher for the distribution of our RapidWN(TM)," stated Mr. Robert Verhagen, Vice President of Business Development for Spectral. "Fisher's large and experienced sales force and its extensive geographic coverage provides a significant opportunity for entry of our product into the U.S. market", added Mr. Verhagen.    Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, enabling its customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. With an annual revenue rate of more than $9 billion, it employs 30,000 people and serves over 350,000 customers within pharmaceutical and biotech companies, hospitals and clinical diagnostic labs, universities, research institutions and government agencies, as well as environmental and industrial process control settings. Serving customers through two premier brands, Thermo Scientific and Fisher Scientific, the company helps solve analytical challenges from routine testing to complex research and discovery. Thermo Scientific offers customers a complete range of high-end analytical instruments as well as laboratory equipment, software, services, consumables and reagents to enable integrated laboratory workflow solutions. Fisher Scientific provides a complete portfolio of laboratory equipment, chemicals, supplies and services used in healthcare, scientific research, safety and education. Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. offers the most convenient purchasing options to customers and continuously advances technologies to accelerate the pace of scientific discovery, enhance value for customers and fuel growth for shareholders and employees alike. Visit www.thermofisher.com.    Spectral is a developer of innovative technologies for comprehensive disease management. Spectral provides accurate and timely information to clinicians enabling the early initiation of appropriate and targeted therapy. Current products include Spectral's FDA approved rapid diagnostic for sepsis (EAA(TM)) and its FDA approved rapid diagnostic for West Nile Virus (RapidWN(TM)), as well as a range of other biological reagents. Spectral's common shares are listed on The Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol SDI. Visit www.spectraldx.com.    Information in this news release that is not current or historical factual information may constitute forward-looking information within the meaning of securities laws. Implicit in this information, particularly in respect of the future outlook of Spectral and anticipated events or results, are assumptions based on beliefs of Spectral's senior management as well as information currently available to it. While these assumptions were considered reasonable by Spectral at the time of preparation, they may prove to be incorrect. Readers are cautioned that actual results are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties, including the availability of funds and resources to pursue R&D projects, the successful and timely completion of clinical studies, the ability of Spectral to take advantage of business opportunities in the biomedical industry, the granting of necessary approvals by regulatory authorities as well as general economic, market and business conditions, and could differ materially from what is currently expected.    %SEDAR: 00002006E         /CONTACT: Spectral Diagnostics Inc., Mr. Anthony Businskas, Chief Financial Officer, (416) 626-3233 ex. 2200     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 08:31 ET (12:31 GMT)

Headline: MARKET TALK: British Airways Up Ahead of Traffic Update
Story: 0758 GMT [Dow Jones]--British Airways (BAY.LN) +0.8% at 422p ahead of June traffic data due at 1315 GMT. Andrew Fitchie at Collins Stewart says that in the context of BA, he expects relatively flat demand (given that supply only increases in 2H) and expects to hear that long haul premium remains strong with non-premium remaining weak in transatlantic and parts of the short haul network. Headline: US-Based SystemsNet Interested In Buying Getronics -Newspaper
Story: AMSTERDAM (Dow Jones)--U.S. based information technology firm SystemsNet is interested in buying Dutch peer Getronics NV 35591.AE), Dutch daily De Telegraaf reports Wednesday citing unnamed sources.   Other interested parties are U.S-based private equity firm Platinum Equity and Hewlett-Packard Co. (HPQ), according to the newspaper.   Tuesday, Getronics said it has received interest from an unnamed U.S.-based firm that wants to buy all the company's shares. That statement send the stock up over 20% on the Amsterdam market yesterday.     Newspaper Web site: http://www.dft.nl     -By Amsterdam Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 31-20-626-0770     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:45 ET (06:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Sodexho Announces Organic Revenue -2-
Story: Recent commercial successes included Oracle (Food Pass) in India, for 16,000 beneficiaries of Foodpass, and Caixa Foundation of Barcelona, Spain, for assistance vouchers. Service offerings to the Caixa Foundation are designed to combat child poverty by enabling families to meet their needs in terms of food, clothing and other essential goods while also providing them with access to an array of services, including baby-sitting, childcare and psychological counseling.       Recent events     On April 11, Sodexho signed an agreement to purchase Tir Groupe's gift vouchers and cards business, France's leading issuer of gift vouchers to businesses and local communities. Tir Groupe generated issue volume of EUR 300 million in 2006. In addition, on June 11, Sodexho acquired 100% of the shares in Vivaboxes, a Belgian company that markets an innovative gift voucher concept in several countries.     To extend the maturity of its debt and take advantage of current interest rates, Sodexho refinanced a portion of its debt on March 30, 2007 through a EUR 500 million bond issue for a seven-year term, carrying an annual coupon of 4.5%.       Fiscal 2007 objectives     The Group is able to manage current inflationary pressures through the effects of productivity programs on food and labor costs.     For the current fiscal year, Sodexho confirms the following objectives:       --  organic revenue growth exceeding 7% and       --  operating profit growth of around 12%, (excluding currency          impact)*       *Versus Fiscal 2006 comparable underlying operating profit of 577  million euros, excluding the gain on disposition of Spirit Cruises and  the US litigation provision release       --  Conference call     SODEXHO ALLIANCE will hold a conference call today to discuss revenues for the first nine months of Fiscal 2007. The call will begin at 8:30 am (Paris time). The call-in access number is +33 (0)1 72 28 08 88. The press release and the slideshow will be available on the internet by clicking on the link www.sodexho.com, under the "Latest News" section, beginning at 7:00 am. To access the rebroadcast of the conference call, please dial +33 (0)1 72 28 01 49, code: 201037 #.       --  Access to information     Quarterly financial information about Sodexho can be found on the Company's website: www.sodexho.com       --  Financial communications calendar       --  Fiscal 2007 revenues     Wednesday, October 3, 2007. Headline: MARKET TALK: KBC Lowers Punch Telematix To Accumulate
Story: 0842 GMT [Dow Jones]--KBC downgrades Punch Telematix (PTX.BT) to accumulate from buy and drops price target to EUR12.5 from EUR17.5, citing a possible operating loss for 2007. A lack of acquisitions and postponed portable devices launch will delay sales growth, says an analyst. Although KBC sees "no short-term drivers for the share price," it remains optimistic about the company's long-term potential amid a growing telematics sector. Shares trade -14% at EUR10.45. Headline: Germany's KfW Raises 2007 Refi Volume To EUR60B From EUR55B
Story: FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--Germany's state-owned KfW Banking Group said Wednesday it had increased its refinancing requirement for 2007 to about EUR60 billion from EUR55 billion due to the positive development of the country's economy.   "For the current year we now expect a refinancing requirement of around EUR60 billion," KfW president Guenther Braeunig said.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:00 ET (10:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: EMS-Chemie Discloses 7.9% Stake In Lonza Group >EMSN.VX
Story: ZURICH (Dow Jones)--Switzerland's EMS-Chemie Holding AG (EMSN.VX) said Wednesday that it holds a 7.9% stake in chemical and pharmaceutical ingredient maker Lonza Group AG (LONN.VX), up from 4.44% in January.   EMS, which produces fine chemicals and plastics for the automotive sector, said it holds 3.14% of Lonza through registered shares, and another 4.76% in call options.   The notification is to comply with new disclosure guidelines which the Swiss banking regulator put into place at the beginning of this month, which require stakeholders to tally all shares and other securities and disclose them when they exceed 5%.   EMS reiterated that the long-standing stake in Lonza is financial in nature. The options are held to cover convertible bonds, EMS said.   Company Web Site: http://www.emschem.com     -By Katharina Bart, Dow Jones Newswires; +41 43 443 8043; katharina.bart@dowjones.com     Corrected July 4, 2007 01:03 ET (05:03 ET)  (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 00:45 ET (04:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MARKET TALK: Altium Raises WSP Group Target Price
Story: 0817 GMT [Dow Jones]--Altium increases WSP Group's (WSH.LN) price target to 850p from 800p following an encouraging pre-close update. "First half trading has been strong and has set the group up well for another strong finish to the year," says Altium. Adds it remains confident in seeing meaningful upgrades at the time of the interims, given the momentum building before the busy Autumn trading period. Altium says margins remain on an upward trend as anticipated, making for an encouraging outlook. Maintains a buy rating. Shares trade flat at 748p. Headline: : A&W Revenue Royalties Income Fund Announces July Cash Distribution>AW.UN.T
Story: VANCOUVER, July 4 /CNW/ - A&W Revenue Royalties Income Fund (the Fund) (TSX symbol AW.UN) today declared a cash distribution of 10 cents per trust unit for the period June 1 to June 30, 2007. The distribution will be paid to unitholders of record at the close of business on July 15, 2007, and will be payable on July 31, 2007. For tax purposes 8.958 cents per unit of this distribution will be other taxable income and 1.042 cents per unit will be non-eligible dividends.    On July 31, 2007 A&W Trade Marks Inc. (Trade Marks), the Fund's subsidiary, will pay the equivalent of 10 cents per share in dividends to A&W Food Services of Canada Inc. (Food Services) on its investment in Trade Marks.    Launched on February 15, 2002, the Fund, through its investment in Trade Marks, is entitled to receive royalties from Food Services in the amount of 3% of the sales of the 660 A&W restaurants in the Royalty Pool. Cash distributions are paid monthly. A&W is the second largest quick-service hamburger restaurant chain in Canada by number of restaurants. Operating coast-to-coast, A&W restaurants feature famous trade-marked menu items such as The Burger Family, Chubby Chicken and A&W Root Beer.    %SEDAR: 00017286E         /CONTACT: Don Leslie, Chief Financial Officer, (604) 988-2141, Email: investorrelations@aw.ca, www.awincomefund.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:42 ET (15:42 GMT)

Headline: MARKET TALK: M Stanley Ups Saipem's Target, Keeps Overweight
Story: 0823 GMT [Dow Jones]--Morgan Stanley raises its target price for Saipem (SPM.MI) to EUR31 from EUR24 and keeps an overweight rating on the stock, after the bank's review of the European offshore construction sector indicated that margins for contractors could double in '09. As a result, Morgan Stanley raises its '09 earnings per shares estimates by 16% on average for the sector. "Saipem is our third preferred play with a 19% upside to our target price of EUR31," the bank says. Shares trade +2.4% at EUR26.2. Headline: : Genesis Acquires 617 Acre Land Parcel In Calgary Metropolitan Area>GDC.T
Story: CALGARY, July 3 /CNW/ - Genesis Land Development Corp. ("Genesis" or the "Company") is pleased to announce the acquisition of a 617 acre land parcel adjacent to the hamlet of Delacour, northeast of Calgary and within 10 minutes of driving time from the Calgary International Airport, for a total purchase price of $31,385,500 ($50,868 per acre). A large portion of the land parcel (approximately 306 acres) has area structure plan approval from the Municipal District of Rockyview while the remaining land is directly adjacent to the approved lands. The total combined lands when developed are anticipated to yield approximately 2,500 single-family lots with additional multi-family development. Development of the lands is targeted to commence by 2009. To finance the acquisition, Genesis has launched a Limited Partnership offering that will be sold as a "Prospectus Exempt" security using the regulations set forth in National Instrument (NI) - 45-106, using either the "Offering Memorandum" or "Accredited Investor" exemptions across most provinces in Canada. A copy of the offering documents can be obtained by contacting Genesis directly.    Mr. Gobi Singh, President and CEO of Genesis, had the following comment, "We are excited to be able to secure additional land inventory (Genesis presently has 13,000 multi-family units, 12,000 single-family lots and one million sq. ft. of commercial space in its undeveloped inventory) in the Calgary metropolitan area. This transaction is of significant size and will contribute in augmenting our lot and residential housing production while allowing the Company to plan a comprehensive future development incorporating single-family residential, multi-family residential and commercial components."    For the three months ended June 30, 2007, Genesis closed a total of 52 lot sales to external home builders and 35 single-family home sales. Through the first six months of 2007, Genesis has closed a total of 114 lot sales to external home builders and 73 single-family home sales. The production levels over the last six months of 2007 are anticipated to increase from the levels achieved in the first six months of the year and the Company is on track to meet its targeted levels of 180 single-family home sales and 350 - 400 external lot sales in 2007.    Genesis Land Development Corp. is a Calgary based land development company with an inventory of more than 24,000 future residential building sites (single-family and multi-family) and over 300 acres of commercial/ industrial lands in Western Canada, of which more than 13,000 residential lots and over 300 acres of commercial/industrial lands are located in the Calgary metropolitan area.    Certain statements in this news release could constitute forward-looking statements. The Corporation's line of business involves risk, uncertainties and other factors which may cause actual results, performance or achievements of Genesis to be materially different from any future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by such forward looking statements. Such factors include the number of dwelling sites that Genesis will actually develop and sell.             /CONTACT: Frank Devcich, C.F.O., Genesis Land Development Corp., Toll Free: (403) 265-8079, 1-800-341-7211, Fax: (403) 266-0746, E-Mail: genesis@genesisland.com, Internet: www.genesisland.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:31 ET (10:31 GMT)

Headline: : Bell Introduces All Access Music Services For Sharing Music Online And On The Go>BCE.T
Story: TORONTO, Ontario, July 4 /CNW Telbec/ - Bell today announced All Access Music and All Access Music to Go, offering subscribers access to more than 1.5 million music tracks, including the world's leading catalogue of French Canadian music. Subscribers will find that building a personal music library, discovering new artists, sharing favourite tracks with friends, or listening to music on the go has never been easier.    All Access Music lets subscribers listen to and share their online music library from any Internet-connected computer, all for less than the cost of a single CD a month. With All Access Music to Go, music lovers can download unlimited music tracks as often as they like to any compatible mobile audio player.    "Music enthusiasts demand simple access to a wide variety of today's best music and the flexibility to take their music with them," said Kevin Crull, President, Bell Residential Services. "Bell provides consumers with a one-stop shop, combining Sympatico High Speed Internet and Canada's best online music library with one convenient monthly payment."    For the ultimate music package from Bell, customers can combine Sympatico High Speed Internet service, All Access Music to Go and the Samsung K5 MP3 Player, one of today's hottest portable audio players. This state-of-the-art MP3 player, which customers will own outright at the completion of their two-year subscription, includes 4 GB flash memory, touch-screen control, slide-out speakers, digital tuner and rechargeable battery.    Added Crull: "Customers get access to Sympatico / MSN Music Store's online concerts, celebrity play lists, Top 100 lists, the latest interviews and news from today's top artists, as well as exclusive content via Live at the Orange Lounge - all without fear of viruses, corrupt files, spyware and pop-ups that are often associated with peer-to-peer music download sites."    All Access Music is available for $10 per month or $90 a year, while All Access Music to Go is $12 per month or $120 a year. Customers can also package Sympatico High Speed Internet, All Access Music to Go and the Samsung K5 MP3 Player on a two-year plan. Please visit www.allaccessmusic.ca for details.    About Bell    Bell is Canada's largest communications company, providing consumers with solutions to all their communications needs, including telephone services, wireless communications, high-speed Internet, digital television and voice over IP. Bell also offers integrated information and communications technology (ICT) services to businesses and governments, and is the Virtual Chief Information Officer (VCIO) to small and medium businesses (SMBs). Bell is proud to be a Premier National Partner and the exclusive Communications Partner to the Vancouver 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games. Bell is wholly owned by BCE Inc. For information on Bell's products and services, please visit www.bell.ca. For corporate information on BCE, please visit www.bce.ca.         /CONTACT: Paolo Pasquini, Bell Canada, Media Relations, (416) 581-4268, 1-888-482-0809, paolo.pasquini@bell.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 09:50 ET (13:50 GMT)

Headline: UPDATE: Brazil Meat Cos Target Of Tax Fraud Investigation
Story: (Updates with publicly traded JBS SA not involved in investigation, in fourth paragraph)     SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Fifteen Brazilian meatpackers in the northern half of the country were targeted for tax fraud involving around 100 million Brazilian reals ($49 million), the Brazilian Revenue Service said in a press statement Wednesday.   The companies are located in Para, Maranhao, Piaui, Pernambuco and Paraiba states. Company names weren't released.   Investigators allege that the companies were buying and selling cattle through "phantom companies" using phony purchasing contracts designed to make it easier for the companies to avoid paying taxes.   Publicly traded meat company JBS SA (JBSS3.BR) said it doesn't have meatpacking facilities in those states and therefore wasn't the target of the investigation. JBS owns the Friboi Group, Brazil's largest meat-packing company selling fresh beef and processed beef under the Anglo, Libby's and Streamline brands. The company also recently acquired U.S. meat company Swift Foods Co. for $1.4 billion.   Brazil is the world's leading beef exporter. Most of Brazil's top beef companies are located in the southern half of the country.     -By Kenneth Rapoza, Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145-1488; ken.rapoza@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 15:23 ET (19:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

The Rating Also Reflects The Fund Advisor's Strong Investment, Research And Risk Management Capabilities. The MR3 Market Risk Rating Reflects The Fund's Moderate Sensitivity To Interest Rate Changes, Primarily Due To It's Effective Duration Which Was 6.0 Years As Of 20 June 2007. Headline: Arnault: LVMH Isn't Interested In Buying Clarins - Newspaper
Story: PARIS (Dow Jones)--LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA (12101.FR) isn't interested in buying Clarins (13029.FR), the French cosmetics maker, because its products aren't in the luxury segment the company targets, Chairman Bernard Arnault told Le Figaro in an interview.   While Arnault said his objective is to double the size of LVMH in five years without acquisitions, he didn't deny the company is interested in Tiffany & Co (TIF), the U.S. jeweler, saying only that "the rumor has been circulating for six months."   The price of acquisition has increased recently because of the interest of private equity funds, Arnault said.     Newspaper Web site: http://www.lefigaro.fr     -By Paris Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 33-1-4017 1740     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:56 ET (06:56 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

However, Sodexho subsidiaries' income   and expenses are expressed in the same currency, hence, contrary to   exporting companies, currency variations carry no operating risk.     Commenting on these figures, Sodexho CEO, Michel Landel, said: "With continuing strong organic growth during the first nine months, Sodexho continues to benefit from its extensive international network and the comprehensiveness of its service offer. We are reinforcing our global leadership and have been ranked fourth worldwide among global outsourcing companies and first in our industry category, "Facilities Services," by the International Association of Outsourcing Professionals.     In the U.S., the world's largest market for outsourcing, we have made remarkable progress, particularly in the high-potential segments of Healthcare and Education. We were also one of the first in our industry to invest in Latin America and in Asia-Australia. This is enabling us to benefit from the accelerating growth in these regions, particularly, China and India.     Our performance reinforces our confidence in our objectives for the full fiscal year of organic revenue growth exceeding 7% and operating profit growth of around 12%, excluding currency impact."       Food and Facilities Management Services       --  North America + 7.7%: accelerated growth       --  Continental Europe + 4.4%: varying performance across          countries       --  United Kingdom and Ireland + 5.2%: solid growth, led by          Healthcare       --  Rest of the World + 17.2%: continued strong momentum     In North America, initiatives by Sodexho teams to improve client retention and increase comparable unit sales helped drive a return to growth in Business & Industry (+ 6.2%). New sales growth accelerated, notably with the signing of new contracts with Walt Disney in California, WellPoint nationally, and Pfizer's facility in Kalamazoo, Michigan.     Healthcare reported excellent (+ 8.4%) organic growth in revenues, led by strong development on existing sites of offerings, notably in Facilities Management, tailored to the needs of patients, visitors and hospital staff. New contract wins included St. Mary's Health Center in Missouri and St. John's Hospital in Illinois.     The strong (+ 8%) growth in Education was influenced by several factors:       --  an increase in university enrollment;       --  demand for Facilities Management services both on university          campuses and for construction projects from schools in New          Orleans, where Sodexho is the local market leader.     New contracts were signed with Clark University in Massachusetts and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in New York in Facilities Management.       In the U.S., Sodexho also received several recognitions:       --  Sodexho was recognized for diversity and gender          representation, ranking in the TOP 20 of " Best Companies for          Multicultural Women " by the magazine Working Mother.       --  Sodexho received the Supplier of the Year Award from the VHA          Inc., an association of 2,400 non-profit healthcare providers.       --  Sodexho's recruitment program won the " Best Diversity          Program " in the Recruiting Excellence Awards presented by ERE          Media Inc.     In Continental Europe, Business & Industry reported growth of 3.2%, a result of varying performances across countries:       --  continued strong development in Central Europe       --  excellent comparable unit sales growth, for example, in Spain       --  more moderate performances in certain countries, particularly,          the Netherlands and Italy, linked to the economic environment          and the rigorous application of a profitable growth approach          to sales.     The major event for the period was the April 2007 start-up of a five-year contract with KLM, whereby Sodexho will provide a full range of Facilities Management services at Schiphol Airport, including cleaning, technical building maintenance, transport and groundskeeping.     A number of contracts were also signed, notably with the Pacific and Paroi Nord de la Grande Arche office buildings in Paris, Areva NP in Lyon, Volvo Cars in Goteborg and SAS in Stockholm, Sweden, Nordea in Denmark and CSOB Radlicka in Prague, Czech Republic.     Healthcare was the top-performing segment in Continental Europe (+ 6.9%), reflecting solid growth in comparable unit sales and a high level of new sales activity in Germany and Sweden and, most particularly, in Spain,. Recent contract wins include Hospital del Sureste in Madrid, Spain, and Centre Hospitalier Rene Pleven in Dinan, France.     The Education segment (+ 5%) benefited from the increase in client retention achieved in Fiscal 2006 and strong new sales, led by Germany, Italy and Sweden.     Among recognitions received by Sodexho in Continental Europe during the period:       --  In France, Sodexho became the first Foodservices company to          receive the PNNS 2 (National Program for Nutrition and Health)          label from the Minister for Health for the commitment to          nutritional quality of its " Equilibre " program targeted to          adults.       --  For its involvement in France's " DIF " program, (individual          training rights), Sodexho received the silver trophy from the          Group Demos, one of France's leading professional training          companies.       --  In Belgium, Sodexho received the federal government's          " Equality - Diversity " designation in recognition of          Sodexho's Corporate Social Responsibility program,          particularly for promotion of diversity.     In the United Kingdom & Ireland, Business & Industry (which includes the Defense and Correctional Facilities segments) reported + 5.7% growth, reflecting the fully operational status of major Defense contracts signed in the summer of 2006. New Facilities Management contracts were also signed with the Leicester City Council and Diligenta.     Healthcare (+ 9.6%) remained the most vibrant segment with strong growth in comparable unit sales, a result, in particular, of the full ramp-up during the first nine months of the fiscal year of a number of Public Finance Initiative contracts as well as the start-up of a contract with the prestigious Nuffield Hospital.     In the UK, Sodexho was ranked in the TOP 100 of " Companies that Count " published in the Sunday Times, having reached the " Silver performance band " in the Corporate Responsibility Index.     Double-digit growth in the Rest of the World (+ 17.2%) extended across all regions. Current prices for oil and other raw materials also continued to contribute to solid comparable unit sales growth in the Middle East, Africa and Latin America in Remote Sites. Notable new contracts included North Goonyella Coal Mines in Australia, Petrobras - Revap in Brazil and GE China Technology Center in China.       Recognitions received included:       --  In Singapore, Sodexho was awarded the Distinguished Defence          Partner Award by the Singapore Civil Defence Authority for the          second year in a row.       --  In China, Sodexho won the Award for "Companies of Excellence"          from the China Cuisine Association for its efforts to create          employment opportunities and promote local economic          development and sustainable development.       Service Vouchers and Cards       Organic growth: + 20.1%     Issue volume rose by + 17.9% (at constant consolidation scope and exchange rates) to reach EUR 5.6 billion for the first nine months of the fiscal year.     This strong growth reflects continued strong demand in Latin America, especially in Venezuela. The gift and assistance voucher offers contributed to the business' strong performance in all markets.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 01:00 ET (05:00 GMT)

Headline: MARKET TALK: Hilton Takeover Good For Whitbread - Merrill

Headline: UPDATE: Morgan Crucible 1H To Be Hurt By Strengthening GBP
Story: By Lilly Vitorovich   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Morgan Crucible Co. PLC (MGCR.LN), a U.K. specialist materials company, said Wednesday that its interim results will be hurt by the strengthening of sterling, but it remains on the look out for bolt-on acquisitions.   The weakness of a number of currencies, particularly those related to the U.S. dollar, will hit its first-half  revenue by around GBP20 million and GBP4 million on its underlying operating profit compared to the same period last year, Morgan Crucible said in a trading update ahead of its interim results on Aug. 1.   However, on a constant currency basis, the business is performing "strongly", with revenue growth up around 8% in the first six months of 2007. The result is largely thanks to the strong performance of the group's Thermal Ceramics business.   Morgan Crucible said the strength of its balance sheet gives it "the flexibility to pursue bolt-on acquisitions to support our core businesses and accelerate our growth strategy."   "As we have indicated before, if we are unable to find suitable acquisitions at the right price we are committed to improving balance sheet efficiency as we have demonstrated with our share buyback program," Morgan Crucible said.   Morgan Crucible said the board "remains confident in the strength of our core businesses and in the potential for continued improvement in our operating profit margins. The platform we have created allows us to look forward to further progress in the second half of the year."   Chief Executive Mark Robertshaw said the group's strategy "remains to focus on higher margin, higher growth, higher value-added products and markets and to continue to drive down our cost base as we further rationalize our manufacturing footprint and increase our proportion of manufacturing in low-cost locations."   "We are also continuing to look actively for acquisitions to support our core businesses; however, we are determined to maintain our financial and strategic discipline if we believe sellers' price expectations to be unrealistic.   "The healthy organic growth of the Group combined with our robust balance sheet put Morgan Crucible in a strong position to continue to drive towards our target of mid-teen operating profit margins," he said.   In the first half of 2007, group operating profit margins post restructuring were up more than 11% from 6.3% in the same period a year earlier.   "The momentum in Group underlying profit margins has continued into 2007 with margins before restructuring and one-off costs expected to be over 12% for the half year compared to 10.6% in the first half of 2006 with all   divisions once again delivering margin progression," Morgan Crucible said.   Morgan Crucible shares closed at 293 pence Tuesday, valuing the company at GBP822.4 million.     Company Web site: http://www.morgancrucible.com   -By Lilly Vitorovich, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-0-207 842 9290; lilly.vitorovich@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:39 ET (06:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UAE IPIC Invites Bids For Fujairah Crude Export Pipeline - 2
Story: Abu Dhabi, the largest U.A.E. sheikdom, plans to build the oil export pipeline to transport up to 1.5 million barrels a day of crude to Fujairah to bypass the Strait of Hormuz, the 33-mile-wide channel through which Persian Gulf oil producers ship their crude exports.   Oil prices have risen over the past two years partly on fears Iran could block exports from the region through Hormuz if tensions with the U.S. over the Islamic republic's nuclear program escalate.   The pipeline would minimize Abu Dhabi's exposure to the Strait.   - -     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:51 ET (10:51 GMT)

Headline: : Skanska Launches First Finnish Commercial Development Project - Investment Amounts to SEK 290 M
Story: STOCKHOLM, Sweden--(BUSINESS WIRE)--July 04, 2007--   Skanska (STO:SKAB) is now launching the development of commercial projects in Finland. In Helsinki, Skanska is developing a new office property with 10,000 square meters of floor space. The investment is expected to amount to approximately SEK 290 M, EUR 31.6 M.     The first leasing contract has been signed for the premises in the Lintulahti project in central Helsinki. Construction is scheduled to commence during the third quarter of 2007, and occupancy is planned for the second quarter of 2009. The construction assignment will be performed by Skanska Finland. Implementation of the project is subject to the receipt of the necessary permits.     "The fact that we are expanding into the Finnish market is logical. The business model that has long been successful in Sweden, Denmark and Central Europe will also generate a healthy return in Finland," says Fredrik Wirdenius, President of Skanska Commercial Development Nordic Region. "Tenants are demanding modern and efficient premises, at the same time as international investors are showing an increasing interest in the Finnish real estate market."     "We also have a solid ground on which to develop the operation, since Skanska in Finland is excellently established as both a developer of residential projects and as a contractor. We are focusing on developing offices in Helsinki and retail complexes in growth regions," says Fredrik Wirdenius.     Jan Johnsson, with extensive experience of Skanska's commercial project development activities in Sweden, Denmark and Hungary, is responsible for building up Skanska's operations involving the development of commercial projects in Finland. Jan Johnsson assumes responsibility for the Finnish operations following a position as President of Skanska's commercial development operations in Budapest, where he was active from 2002 to 2006.     Skanska Commercial Development Nordic initiates and develops real estate projects involving offices, logistics facilities and shopping centers. Office operations focus on the three large metropolitan regions in Sweden, the Copenhagen region of Denmark and Helsinki, Finland. The development of logistics facilities and volume retail properties is conducted in strategic locations in Sweden, Denmark and Finland. Skanska Commercial Development Nordic Region is divided into three regional companies: Gothenburg, Stockholm and Oresund.       This and previous releases can also be found at www.skanska.com     This is the type of information that Skanska AB may be obligated to disclose in accordance with the Swedish Securities Exchange and Clearing Operations Act and/or the Financial Instruments Trading Act.     Skanska is one of the world's leading construction groups with expertise in construction, development of commercial and residential projects and public-private partnerships. The Group currently has 56,000 employees in selected home markets in Europe, in the US and Latin America. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden and listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange, Skanska's sales in 2006 totaled USD 17 billion.     This information was brought to you by Cision http://newsroom.cision.com        CONTACT: Fredrik Wirdenius, President               Skanska Commercial Development Nordic               tel +46 70 553 80 62               or               Peter Gimbe, Press Officer               Skanska AB               tel +46 8 753 88 38               Direct line for media: +46 8 753 88 99        SOURCE: Skanska  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:43 ET (06:43 GMT)

Headline: Sinopec Maoming Refinery To Undergo Maintenance Jul 10-Aug 30
Story: BEIJING (Dow Jones)--Chinese refiner China Petroleum & Chemical Corp.'s (SNP) Maoming refinery in southern China is scheduled to undergo regular maintenance from July 10 to Aug. 30, an industry information agency said Wednesday.   Three units in Sinopec's 270,000 barrel-a-day refinery will undergo maintenance - a distillation unit July 10-July 30, a hydrocracking unit July 15-Aug. 16 and a catalytic unit July 15-Aug. 30, said Beijing Jcache Energy Information Services.   The refinery will lower its crude runs during the two months, with July runs to fall 14.5% from June to 236,500 barrels a day, it said, without giving the figure for August.   The refinery is Sinopec's second largest after Zhenhai.     -Renya Peng contributed to this story, Dow Jones Newswires; (8610) 6588 5848; renya.peng@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 02:26 ET (06:26 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Microchip Technology Sues Chinese Company For Alleged Piracy
Story: SHANGHAI (AP)--Semiconductor maker Microchip Technology Inc. (MCHP) said Wednesday that it is suing a Chinese manufacturer for alleged illegal copying of its microcode and other proproprietary information.   Chandler, Arizona-based Microchip said it filed a copyright infringement lawsuit against Shanghai Haier Integrated Circuit Co. in Shanghai's No. 1 Intermediate People's Court.   Details about the lawsuit or any damages sought were not immediately available   "Intellectual property is the backbone of our company and our industry," said William Yang, Microchip's vice president for the Asia-Pacific, said in a written statement.   Staff at Shanghai Haier IC had no immediate comment.   Microchip Technology said it also filed a "related legal action" against Linkage Technology Co., a company based in Taiwan's high-tech hub of Hsinchu that it said was a Taiwanese distributor for Shanghai Haier IC.   The microcode in question was embedded in a Microchip Technology's PIC16CXXX microcontrollers, the company said. Microcontrollers are used in many industries, including consumer electronics, vehicles, telecommunications equipment and industrial automation.   Microchip Technology also alleged that Shanghai Haier IC, a unit of Chinese appliance maker Haier Group, copied datasheets detailing the use and operation of the U.S. company's microcontrollers.   Microcontrollers are used in a wide range of industries and applications, including consumer electronics, automobiles, telecommunications, industrial automation and many others.       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 07:32 ET (11:32 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: EU Court Rules Changes To SFR, Orange 3G Licenses Were Legal -2
Story: The court ruling saves SFR, jointly owned by Vivendi SA (12777.FR) and Vodafone Group PLC (VOD); and Orange, the mobile arm of France Telecom (FTE), from having to pay the French government about EUR4 billion apiece.   Orange and SFR in 2001 each paid the government EUR4.95 billion for their 3G licenses, enabling them to offer a range of new mobile services such as wireless data and video. The price of the licenses reflected the dot-com boom and widespread anticipation across Europe that 3G services would be widely used and immensely profitable.   After the internet bubble burst and mobile users proved slow to switch to 3G services, the French government decided that more than two 3G operators were needed to ensure effective competition. In 2002, it sold Bouygues a license for EUR619 million and a percentage of its profits. The government also changed the terms of Orange and SFR's licenses to match the Bouygues deal.     Corrected July 4, 2007 05:44 ET (09:44 GMT)  (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 04:18 ET (08:18 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Alhambra Resources Ltd. - Corporate Update
Story: CALGARY, July 4 /CNW/ - Alhambra Resources Ltd. ("Alhambra" or the "Corporation") announces that its Annual and Special Meeting of Shareholders will be held at The Westin Calgary, 320 - 4th Avenue S.W., Calgary, Alberta on Tuesday, July 31, 2007 at 2 p.m. (Calgary time). At the meeting, in addition to the normal business of the Corporation, the shareholders will be asked to consider, and if thought advisable, approve a reorganization by an arrangement under the Business Corporations Act (Alberta) (the "Arrangement") involving Alhambra, its Shareholders and a newly incorporated corporation, DOT Resources Ltd. ("DOT"). As reported in a news release dated June 20, 2007, the Arrangement, if completed will have the result of dividing Alhambra's mineral assets between two separate publicly traded corporations. Upon implementation of the Arrangement, Alhambra will continue to hold and operate its gold producing assets situated in the Republic of Kazakhstan, while DOT will hold and conduct exploration activities on Alhambra's Canadian mineral properties, situated near Kamloops, British Columbia. Details of the Arrangement are more fully described in the Information Circular that has been mailed to shareholders and is available for review on SEDAR at www.sedar.com.      The Corporation also announces that it has restated its financial statements for the three months ended March 31, 2007 to reflect a recalculation of stock-based compensation. Originally, stock-based compensation was calculated to be $718,935 of which $636,241 was expensed and $82,694 was capitalized to mining assets. As a result of the recalculation, stock-based compensation for the three months ended March 31, 2007 has been reduced to $526,211 of which $479,690 has been expensed and $46,521 has been capitalized to mining assets. As a result of the recalculation, net loss for the three months ended March 31, 2007 has been reduced to $799,291 compared to an earlier reported loss of $955,842. Basic and diluted net loss per share remained unchanged at $0.01. The Restated Interim Financial Statements and Amended Management and Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations for the Three Months Ended March 31, 2007 are available on SEDAR at www.sedar.com.      About Alhambra      Alhambra is a Canadian based gold exploration and production corporation engaged in the exploration of and production from its 100% owned Uzboy Project. Alhambra is currently in its sixth year of operations in the Republic of Kazakhstan.      Alhambra common shares trade on The TSX Venture Exchange under the symbol ALH and in Germany on the Frankfurt Open Market under the symbol A4Y. The Corporation's website can be accessed at www.alhambraresources.com.      The TSX Venture Exchange Inc. has neither approved nor disapproved the      information contained herein.      This news release contains forward-looking information including but not limited to comments regarding the timing and content of upcoming work programs and potential mineral recovery processes. Forward-looking information includes disclosure regarding possible future events, conditions or results of operations that is based on assumptions and courses of action, and therefore, involves inherent risks and uncertainties. For any forward-looking information given, management has assumed that the analytical results it has received are reliable and the metallurgical testing methodologies applied are consistent with industry standards. Although management has a reasonable basis for the conclusions drawn, actual results may differ materially from those currently anticipated in such statements. For such statements, we claim the safe harbor for future.                 /CONTACT: Donald D. McKechnie, Vice President Finance & Chief Financial Officer, (403) 228-2855; Ihor P. Wasylkiw, Chief Information Officer, (403) 508-4953; Jim Clarke, Investor Relations, 1-888-290-1335 (Toll Free)          (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 06:01 ET (10:01 GMT)

Headline: UPDATE: BA, Ryanair Report Lower June Load Factors
Story: By Rod Stone   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--British Airways PLC (BAY.LN) and Ryanair Holdings PLC (RYAAY) Wednesday said their airplanes were more empty on average during June compared with a year earlier and reported mixed trends in passenger traffic.   BA said its passenger load factor fell to 80.5% from 81.9% a year earlier while Ryanair saw its figures drop two percentage points to 85% from 87%. Some carriers have reported some softness in the intra European market owing partly to higher interest rates and increased ticket taxes, while the weaker dollar is hitting the flow of passengers into Europe from the U.S.   BA said passenger traffic - measured in revenue passenger kilometers which factor in how far people are flown - declined 1.4% with premium traffic up 1.4% and non-premium down 1.9%. Actual passenger numbers fell 2.5% to just over three million. The growth in premium traffic is positive for BA as it makes much of its profits from big-spending first- and business-class passengers.   The London-based carrier said market conditions remain broadly unchanged and it is too early to assess how the latest security measures at British airports might hit forward bookings. It said weakness in the U.S. dollar to sterling isn't helpful for revenue but is having a positive impact on costs.   Dublin-based Ryanair, the fast expanding Irish budget airline, meanwhile reported an 18% rise in seats sold to 3.67 million. The company is taking delivery of a net 30 new planes this year and has indicated that it may have to discount its fares this summer to fill its planes amid tough competition.   By 1336 GMT BA shares were up 3.8%, or 16 pence, at 434 pence with Ryanair up 2.2%, or 11 euro cents, at EUR5.20 in Dublin. Headline: Stora Enso Upgrades Board Quality At Its Imatra Mills
Story: Edited Press Release     STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--Stora Enso Wednesday said it is investing EUR15 million to upgrade board manufacturing at its Imatra mills in Finland to meet customers' developing quality requirements.   The project is scheduled to start in July 2007 and be completed in September 2008.   As a consequence of this quality-driven investment, the annual production capacity of board machine 5 will increase from 240,000 to 250,000 tonnes of liquid packaging board.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 08:07 ET (12:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : OMX Nordic Exchange Stockholm Will Not Take Any Actions against Racon Holding AB
Story: STOCKHOLM, Sweden--(BUSINESS WIRE)--July 04, 2007--   On June 12th, 2007, four institutional investors filed a complaint to the Nordic Exchange about Racon Holding AB contravening with the exchange's takeover rules in connection to the public bid to acquire Invik & Co AB. After having investigated the matter, the exchange have found no reason to take any measures against Racon Holding AB.     Parties that have the intention to make a public offer on a listed company on the OMX Nordic Exchange Stockholm (the Exchange) (STO:OMX) are by law required to make a formal undertaking with the Exchange to comply with the Exchange's rules on public takeover bids on the stock market. In that way it is possible for the Exchange to practice sanctions against parties that don't comply with the rules.     In a report to the Exchange of June 12th, 2007 four institutional investors (the Institutions) claimed that Racon Holding AB (Racon) had violated the takeover rules in connection with the public offer from Racon to acquire Invik & Co AB. The Institutions argued that Racon had contravened the rules by offering different reimbursement for A-shares than for B-shares.     In connection to its investigation, the Exchange has obtained a statement from the Securities Council (Aktiemarknadsnamnden) regarding the case.     http://wpy.waymaker.net/client/waymaker1/WOLReleaseFile.aspx? id=492969&fn=wkr0078.pdf (it is only published in Swedish)       (Due to its length, this URL may need to be copied/pasted into  your Internet browser's address field. Remove the extra space if one  exists.)     The Exchange has completed its investigation and can conclude that there are no reasons to take any actions against Racon.       About OMX     OMX is a leading expert in the exchange industry. The common offering from OMX Nordic Exchange in Helsinki, Copenhagen, Stockholm, Iceland, Tallinn, Riga and Vilnius, comprises over 800 companies including its alternative market First North. OMX provides technology to over 60 exchanges, clearing organizations and central securities depositories in over 50 countries. OMX is a Nordic Large Cap company in the Financials sector on the OMX Nordic Exchange. For more information, please visit www.omxgroup.com.     This information was brought to you by Cision http://newsroom.cision.com        CONTACT: OMX               Jonas Rodny, +46 8 405 72 67        SOURCE: OMX Nordic Exchange Stockholm  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 11:42 ET (15:42 GMT)

Headline: : Great Panther To Raise C$4.05M In Pvt Placement Of Conv Loan Notes
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 07/04/07 --    GREAT PANTHER RESOURCES LIMITED (TSX: GPR) ("the Company") is raising $4.05 million through the private placement of two Convertible Loan Notes, each of $2,025,000 with City Natural Resources High Yield Trust PLC and New City High Yield Fund Limited of the British Isles. The Notes will bear interest at 8% per annum, payable quarterly, and will mature in 4 years. The Notes will be convertible at the option of the holders into common shares of the Company at the conversion price of $2.25 per share, which is an approximate 25% premium to the market price of the Company's common shares when the decision to enter into the agreements was made.   The proceeds from the Notes will be used to accelerate exploration activities at the Mapimi Project in Durango, Mexico where geophysical surveys are outlining several large areas interpreted as buried sulphide mineralization worthy of drill testing; a deep drilling program at the Guanajuato Mine; and for working capital to increase production at the Company's Guanajuato and Topia Mines.   The Notes and the 1.8 million common shares issued on conversion will be subject to hold periods expiring 4 months plus one day from the date of the Notes. No commissions or finder's fees are payable. The private placement is subject to acceptance for filing by the TSX.   ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD   Kaare G. Foy, Executive Chairman   This news release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 and forward-looking information within the meaning of the Securities Act (Ontario) (together, "forward-looking statements"). Headline: EU Crt Rules Changes To SFR, Orange 3G Licenses Were Legal -3
Story: Bouygues protested, claiming the new terms for Orange and SFR were an illegal state subsidy to business. Bouygues first asked the European Commission, the E.U.'s regulatory arm, to investigate the licensing terms. When the commission cleared the French government of wrongdoing, Bouygues appealed to the European Court of First Instance in Luxembourg.   During a March hearing, the court's panel of judges said they were amazed the French government was willing to walk away from about EUR8 billion in licensing fees. A French government lawyer replied that the state wasn't trying to make money from the licenses, but was trying to manage a public resource effectively.   In its ruling on Wednesday, the court said the reduced fees "applied to Orange and SFR was neutral for the three operators."   A spokesman for Bouygues declined to comment.   Orange and SFR so far haven't seen strong demand for their 3G services. Bouygues plans to launch its 3G services later this year, following pressure from the French regulator to use its license. The French government in March decided to sell a fourth 3G license under the same terms given to Bouygues, Orange and SFR.     -By Adam Cohen and Mike Gordon, Dow Jones Newswires; +322 741 1486; adam.cohen@dowjones.com; +352 691 180 766; mgordon.dowjones@gmail.com   (Jethro Mullen in Paris contributed to this article.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 04:34 ET (08:34 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Claim By Minority Shareholders Of ImageSat International>ESLT
Story: HAIFA, Israel, July 4 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Elbit Systems Ltd. ("Elbit Systems") (NASDAQ: ESLT) announced it was advised that a claim was filed by certain minority shareholders of ImageSat International N.V. ("ImageSat"). The claim was filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York against ImageSat, Israel Aerospace Industries Ltd. ("IAI"), Elbit Systems and certain current and former officers and directors of ImageSat. ImageSat's largest shareholder is IAI, holding approximately 46% of ImageSat's issued share capital. A subsidiary of Elbit Systems holds approximately 14% (7% on a fully diluted basis) of ImageSat's issued share capital and is entitled to nominate one director to ImageSat's board. The former and current directors of ImageSat named as defendants include, among others, Michael Federmann, Joseph Ackerman and Joseph Gaspar, Elbit Systems Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, respectively.     ImageSat is engaged in the operation of satellites and in providing satellite imagery. The claim contains various allegations that the defendants allegedly breached their fiduciary and/or contractual obligations to the detriment of the plaintiffs, who are certain of ImageSat's minority shareholders. The claim alleges various causes of action and damages aggregating hundreds of millions of dollars, not all of which are alleged against Elbit Systems and/or each of the former or current ImageSat directors.     Based upon a preliminary review of the claim, Elbit Systems believes that there is no merit to the allegations made against it or the current or former ImageSat directors who were nominated by Elbit Systems' subsidiary. Elbit Systems views the claims against it as baseless and will vigorously defend against them. Moreover, Elbit Systems believes that the nature of the alleged claims provides a basis for counterclaims by Elbit Systems against the plaintiffs.        About Elbit Systems     Elbit Systems Ltd. is an international defense electronics company engaged in a wide range of defense-related programs throughout the world. The Elbit Systems Group, which includes the company and its subsidiaries, operates in the areas of aerospace, land and naval systems, command, control, communications, computers, intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance ("C4ISR"), advanced electro-optic and space technologies, EW suites, airborne warning systems, ELINT systems, data links and military communications systems and equipment. The Group also focuses on the upgrading of existing military platforms and developing new technologies for defense and homeland security applications.     STATEMENTS IN THIS PRESS RELEASE WHICH ARE NOT HISTORICAL DATA ARE FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS WHICH INVOLVE KNOWN AND UNKNOWN RISKS, UNCERTAINTIES OR OTHER FACTORS NOT UNDER THE COMPANY'S CONTROL, WHICH MAY CAUSE ACTUAL RESULTS, PERFORMANCE OR ACHIEVEMENTS OF THE COMPANY TO BE MATERIALLY DIFFERENT FROM THE RESULTS, PERFORMANCE OR OTHER EXPECTATIONS IMPLIED BY THESE FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS. THESE FACTORS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, THOSE DETAILED IN THE COMPANY'S PERIODIC FILINGS WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. Headline: : Rider Resources Ltd. Announces Completion Of Second Lien Term Loan>RRZ.T
Story: CALGARY, ALBERTA--(CCNMatthews - July 3, 2007) -  Rider Resources Ltd. (TSX:RRZ) ("Rider") today announced that, effective June 29, 2007, it has completed its previously announced senior secured second lien term loan in the US institutional loan market for aggregate gross proceeds of US$100,000,000. The second lien facility has a 5 year plus one day term. Concurrently, Rider entered into a cross currency and interest rate swap with Scotia Capital Inc. for aggregate gross proceeds of CDN$107,000,000 and a fixed coupon of 9.53% for the term of the facility.    Net proceeds will be used to repay the bridge facility and reduce revolving indebtedness incurred for the acquisition of certain interests in west central Alberta. Scotia Capital Inc. acted as administrative agent, sole lead arranger and book manager for the second lien facility.    Rider is an independent Canadian oil and natural gas exploration, development and production company with its common shares trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "RRZ". Headline: MARKET TALK: Sportingbet/BWIN Talks Ending Not A Big Surprise
Story: 1044 GMT [Dow Jones] Sportingbet's (SBT.LN) announcement that tie-up talks with Bwin Interactive Entertainment (BWIN.VI) have been called off won't come as a surprise to investors, says Daniel Stewart & Co's James Hollins. Talks were underway for four months, and over that time Bwin shares have been falling, which many believed might affect any deal involving Bwin securities, he adds. Industry uncertainty in Europe would have also been an issue. There's been good institutional support for Sportingbet based on fundamentals of late, with the group doing well operationally, says Hollins, who is reinstating Sportingbet with a buy rating and 62p target price. Daniel Stewart & Co. are house brokers to Sportingbet. Shares trade -9.4% at 53p. Headline: DATA SNAP: Halifax Jun House Prices +0.4% MM, +10.7% YY -2-
Story: The data are in line with other house price surveys reporting a pick-up in prices from May, however, Ellis, along with other economists, believes that the housing market will slow this year under the weight of higher mortgage interest repayments.   But there is little chance of a steep decline as the economy remains strong.   "Solid economic fundamentals and a shortage of housing supply will, nonetheless, continue to support house prices," Ellis said.   And in spite of Ellis and others pointing to signs of a slower housing market in reaction to higher interest rates, the fact that the June survey is stronger than in May will not give the Monetary Policy Committee any reason to keep rates on hold when it announces its next rate decision midday Thursday.   Economists surveyed by Dow Jones Newswires unanimously expect the MPC to raise rates by 25 basis points to 5.75% at the conclusion of its two-day meeting.   Halifax forecasts house prices will rise 4% throughout the year.   Following is a table comparing surveys by major U.K. housing institutions:                 June           May             On Mo   On Yr  On Mo   On Yr  Nationwide +1.1%  +11.1%  +0.5%  +10.3%  Halifax    +0.4%  +10.7%  +0.3%  +10.6%  Rightmove  +0.8%  +13.2%  +0.4%  +13.1%  Hometrack  +0.3%   +6.4%  +0.6%   +6.7%   Company Web site: http://www.halifax.co.uk   -By Ilona Billington, Dow Jones Newswires, +44 20 7842 9452, ilona.billington@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  July 04, 2007 03:34 ET (07:34 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Petroleum Geo-Services ASA: Fiber Optic Permanent Installation in Deep Water Gulf of Mexico
Story: Petroleum Geo-Services ASA: Fiber Optic Permanent  Installation in Deep Water Gulf of Mexico       OSLO, Norway, July 4, 2007 (PRIME NEWSWIRE) -- Petroleum  Geo-Services ASA ('PGS' or the 'Company') (OSE:PGS) (NYSE:PGS) is  scheduled to deploy its first 4C Fiber-Optic seismic monitoring system  for a permanent seabed installation in deepwater Gulf of Mexico in the  fourth quarter this year for Chevron Energy Technology Company, a  Chevron Corporation subsidiary.       PGS has developed a unique fiber-optic technology for  permanent installations. A prototype of the current design was  successfully tested in collaboration with Chevron in the Gulf of Mexico  last summer. The fiber-optic system is a complete passive wet-end  system that provides a higher reliability and durability than  conventional electrical system. PGS' unique multiplexing designs offer  very high channel count per cable, low noise and crosstalk properties  as well as a high dynamic range.       Group President of PGS Data Processing & Technology, Sverre  Strandenes commented the following:       "The first permanent deployment of our 4C fiber-optic  seismic monitoring system is an important milestone for us. We are  pleased to be working with Chevron who has been very supportive in  evaluating our fiber optic technology. The permanent seismic monitoring  market is an emerging market with a significant potential. It is our  intention to be a major market player."       Mark Koelmel, General Manager of Earth Science technology,  Chevron Energy Technology Company, said the following:       "Permanent seismic monitoring is becoming an important tool  in the reservoir management toolkit. We are excited about this  opportunity to work with the advanced technology provided by PGS."       Petroleum Geo-Services is a focused geophysical company  providing a broad range of seismic and reservoir services, including  acquisition, processing, interpretation, and field evaluation. The  company also possesses the world's most extensive multi-client data  library. PGS operates on a worldwide basis with headquarters at  Lysaker, Norway.       For more information on Petroleum Geo-Services visit  www.pgs.com.       The information included herein contains certain  forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the  Securities Act of 1933 and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act  of 1934.
